Title: Data Scientist Junior
Description:
Descripción de la empresa

¿Quienes somos? ‍‍

MIOTI es el primer instituto tecnológico aplicado a los negocios, lo que lo convierte en pionero en el sector y referente en formación especializada en #Data_Science, #Internet_of_Things y #eBusiness. Nuestro propósito es formar a personas y empresas en las habilidades tecnológicas más demandadas en el futuro.

Somos expertos en formación tecnológica en España y Latinoamérica. Nos acompañan los mejores profesionales del sector. Nuestra metodología es única, #Learning_By_Doing 100% Aprendizaje 0% Postureo, así ofrecemos a nuestros alumnos una formación experiencial única y hacemos realidad el desarrollo de proyectos tecnológicos con impacto real en la economía digital.

Y qué mejor forma de aplicar tecnología a los negociosque desarrollar nosotros mismos proyectos de datos para nuestros clientes desde nuestro departamento MIOTI #Data&AIServices aplicando todas las tecnologías y herramientas en las que formamos.

En MIOTI #Data&AIServices ayudamos a nuestros clientes a generar su estrategia de datos IA y aplicarla para capturar valor. Evaluando el estado de sus datos, identificando qué procesos hay que rediseñar y por qué, rediseñando su arquitectura y gobierno de los datos, integrando la inteligencia artificial en la toma de decisiones, desarrollando conocimientos y habilidades en los equipos orientados a la toma de decisiones.

Nuestro mejor activo son las personas, contamos con un equipo jóven, inclusivo y multicultural que trabaja en lo que ama y que logra cumplir todos los objetivos que se plantean, gracias a una organización horizontal y una cultura empresarial única. Distintos perfiles profesionales se complementan y colaboran entre sí, favoreciendo un ambiente y un flujo de trabajo eficiente, dinámico y muy positivo.

Somos un instituto en continuo crecimiento y tenemos muy claro que para alcanzar el éxito necesitamos el mejor talento de todos. Nuestros equipos están formados por personas altamente especializadas que trabajan mano a mano ️, todos los días para alcanzar el reconocimiento de nuestros alumnos y clientes y crecer con ellos.

Descripción del empleo

Estamos buscando a un #excepcional Junior Data Scientist que sea capaz de entender los retos de nuestros clientes, hacerlos suyos y que nos ayude a establecer relaciones a largo plazo con ellos, garantizando el éxito y la ejecución de los proyectos.

Queremos un perfil que pueda aportar soluciones innovadoras para resolver los problemas desde un punto de vista analítico, orientado al tratamiento de los datos y que nos permita generar valor con el uso de modelos de ciencia de datos.

Funciones del puesto


Grado en carreras STEM, Matemáticas, Estadística, Ingeniería de Telecomunicaciones o Informática, etc.
Alto conocimiento de Python, especialmente en el uso de librerías como: Numpy, Pandas, Scikit Learn, Matplotlib, Bokeh, Polars, etc.
Se valora positivamente ➕
Formación adicional en ciencia de datos.
Proactividad y pasión por la tecnología.
Ganas de trabajar en equipo.
Curiosidad intelectual y persistencia para resolver problemas.
Experiencia de al menos 6 meses en proyectos reales/de empresa, relacionados con #data
Enfocado en la calidad, escalabilidad y código limpio.
Manejo de bases de datos relacionales (SQL) y no relacionales (MongoDB / Redis / Clickhouse).
Manejo herramientas de visualización de datos para la generación de reportes.
Conocimientos básicos de series temporales, análisis de estacionalidad y tendencia, detección de anomalías. Predicción de series temporales.
Conocimientos de técnicas de Machine Learning y Deep Learning.
Conocimientos en aplicación de nuevas tendencias de IA Generativa.
Conocimiento de trabajo en entornos como Google Colab o Amazon Sagemaker.


Requisitos


Grado en carreras STEM, Matemáticas, Estadística, Ingeniería de Telecomunicaciones o Informática, etc.
Alto conocimiento de Python, especialmente en el uso de librerías como: Numpy, Pandas, Scikit Learn, Matplotlib, Bokeh, Polars, etc.
Se valora positivamente ➕
Formación adicional en ciencia de datos.
Proactividad y pasión por la tecnología.
Ganas de trabajar en equipo.
Curiosidad intelectual y persistencia para resolver problemas.
Experiencia de al menos 6 meses en proyectos reales/de empresa, relacionados con #data
Enfocado en la calidad, escalabilidad y código limpio.
Manejo de bases de datos relacionales (SQL) y no relacionales (MongoDB / Redis / Clickhouse).
Manejo herramientas de visualización de datos para la generación de reportes.
Conocimientos básicos de series temporales, análisis de estacionalidad y tendencia, detección de anomalías. Predicción de series temporales.
Conocimientos de técnicas de Machine Learning y Deep Learning.
Conocimientos en aplicación de nuevas tendencias de IA Generativa.
Conocimiento de trabajo en entornos como Google Colab o Amazon Sagemaker.


Información adicional


Oportunidad de prosperar en un entorno de alto emprendimiento y de alto crecimiento
Participar de forma activa en el diseño de un producto tanto en la parte de desarrollo de software como de negocio
Grandes compañeros con los aprender y trabajar
Contrato indefinido, ¡buscamos relaciones a largo plazo!
Salario competitivo entre 28.000€ y 35.000€.
Beneficios sociales de la empresa (seguro de salud, tarjeta restaurante, tarjeta transporte, etc...)
Disfrute de nuestro espacio de “workation” TheCUBE Zahara ️
Eventos semanales de team building
Teletrabajo (3 días por semana, horario flexible, jornada intensiva en verano...)

Requisitos

  • Grado en carreras STEM, Matemáticas, Estadística, Ingeniería de Telecomunicaciones o Informática, etc.
  • Alto conocimiento de Python, especialmente en el uso de librerías como: Numpy, Pandas, Scikit Learn, Matplotlib, Bokeh, Polars, etc.
  • Se valora positivamente ➕
  • Formación adicional en ciencia de datos.
  • Proactividad y pasión por la tecnología.
  • Ganas de trabajar en equipo.
  • Curiosidad intelectual y persistencia para resolver problemas.
  • Experiencia de al menos 6 meses en proyectos reales/de empresa, relacionados con #data
  • Enfocado en la calidad, escalabilidad y código limpio.
  • Manejo de bases de datos relacionales (SQL) y no relacionales (MongoDB / Redis / Clickhouse).
  • Manejo herramientas de visualización de datos para la generación de reportes.
  • Conocimientos básicos de series temporales, análisis de estacionalidad y tendencia, detección de anomalías. Predicción de series temporales.
  • Conocimientos de técnicas de Machine Learning y Deep Learning.
  • Conocimientos en aplicación de nuevas tendencias de IA Generativa.
  • Conocimiento de trabajo en entornos como Google Colab o Amazon Sagemaker.

Información adicional

  • Oportunidad de prosperar en un entorno de alto emprendimiento y de alto crecimiento
  • Participar de forma activa en el diseño de un producto tanto en la parte de desarrollo de software como de negocio
  • Grandes compañeros con los aprender y trabajar
  • Contrato indefinido, ¡buscamos relaciones a largo plazo!
  • Salario competitivo entre 28.000€ y 35.000€.
  • Beneficios sociales de la empresa (seguro de salud, tarjeta restaurante, tarjeta transporte, etc...)
  • Disfrute de nuestro espacio de “workation” TheCUBE Zahara ️
  • Eventos semanales de team building
  • Teletrabajo (3 días por semana, horario flexible, jornada intensiva en verano...)

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
¿Te apasiona la ciencia de datos y el desarrollo de soluciones analíticas? 👀




➥ Unirte a Innova, es formar parte de una empresa de consultoría líder a nivel nacional y en pleno desarrollo internacional. Si estás interesado en participar en proyectos innovadores de IA, Cloud Computing y Transformación Digital, creemos este es tu lugar. 🤝




En Innova-tsn buscamos incorporar profesionales con 3 años de experiencia en proyectos de ciencia de datos y modelización avanzada, para reforzar nuestro equipo en diferentes sectores como energía, retail, banca y más.




📌 ¿Qué buscamos?




Experiencia como Data Scientist de al menos 3 años en desarrollo y mantenimiento de modelos.
Conocimiento avanzado de técnicas de tratamiento y preparación de datos y analítica descriptiva.
Conocimiento del desarrollo, mantenimiento y monitorización de modelos de Machine Learning (Regresión, Clustering, XGBoost, Random Forest….) y técnicas de Forecasting.
Conocimiento avanzado de los lenguajes Python y R.
Estudios mínimos: Licenciatura/Grado en Matemáticas, Estadística, Ingeniería, Físicas, Económicas…




✅ ...es un plus!

Buen nivel en SAS y PySpark.
Perfil matemático con habilidades técnicas en el entorno de datos.




📈 ¿Qué valoramos?




Máster en Data Science, Machine Learning, Inteligencia Artificial.
Experiencia en Desarrollo de Redes Neuronales en frameworks como Keras, Pytorch, TensorFlow.
Conocimiento/experiencia de algoritmos de Optimización.
Experiencia en el desarrollo en entornos colaborativos (Github, Gitlab).
Experiencia en MLOps.
Conocimiento de LLMs: Técnicas de Prompt Engineering, RAG y Fine tuning.
·Experiencia /certificación en plataformas Cloud (AWS, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud) tanto en el desarrollo como el despliegue de modelos.
Nivel avanzado de inglés.
Habilidad para trabajar en equipo y aportar en entornos colaborativos.




👋 ¿Qué te ofrecemos nosotros?




Contrato indefinido, invertimos y buscamos tu desarrollo a largo plazo.
Formaciones en plataformas e internas, y certificaciones oficiales a cargo de la empresa.
Planes de carrera personalizados, adaptados a tus fortalezas e intereses y basados en evaluaciones de desempeño anuales.
Beneficios sociales: seguro médico de cobertura completa.
Retribución flexible: ticket guardería y ticket restaurant.
Ser parte de un equipo especializado en soluciones empresariales y arquitectura de datos.




En Innova, fomentamos mucho el desarrollo del talento, la creatividad y el trabajo en equipo. Invertimos en espacios, tecnologías y herramientas para que los que componen nuestra compañía profundicen en sus habilidades, exploren nuevas áreas y se sientan una pieza fundamental.




Si estás buscando un lugar donde impulsar y desarrollar tu carrera profesional, únete a nosotros y sé parte de este equipo innovador 🤓

Title: Data Scientist Demanda y Precios
Description:
Description And Requirements

Descripción y requisitos:

Si quieres un nuevo reto profesional, donde colaborarás en cambiar el mundo de la energía, estamos buscando un/a Analista de Demanda y Precios para unirse al equipo de Madrid.

¿Con quién trabajarás?

Demanda y Precios es un área multidisciplinar perteneciente a la línea de negocio de Market. Nuestra misión principal es asegurar que el conjunto de las operaciones de energía de la comercializadora conduce a una rentabilidad satisfactoria y sostenible. Para ello, integramos un conjunto amplio de funciones que manejamos de forma coordinada con otras áreas de la compañía: la planificación, la gestión de riesgos, la demanda, el suministro, los productos, los precios, las ofertas, el asesoramiento a clientes y la normativa. Para ello nos apoyamos en nuestra visión global de negocio y en un elevado grado de conocimiento de mercados mayoristas y retail.

Nuestras operaciones conllevan un gran volumen de datos y la digitalización es un elemento esencial en nuestra actividad. Por ello contamos con un equipo de personas con amplios conocimientos en tecnología y datos.

El equipo de modelos aplica las últimas tendencias del mercado en analítica avanzada para desarrollar modelos de Machine Learning o Inteligencia Artificial, que son utilizados como base de nuestros procesos de toma de decisiones.

¿De qué te encargarás?

En este puesto, tus responsabilidades serán:


Diseño y desarrollo de modelo matemáticos (Machine Learning, Advanced Analytics, Inteligencia Artificial, Data Science…). Ejemplos: modelos de previsión de la demanda de nuestros clientes (gas y electricidad) de corto y largo plazo, modelos de optimización de la gestión logística del gas, modelos de emisión de recomendaciones para el asesoramiento postventa de nuestros clientes...
Seguimiento y mantenimiento de modelos en producción.
Definición, implantación y mejora del framework de despliegue y gobierno de modelos.
Participación en proyectos corporativos que involucren modelos para la actividad de Demanda y Precios


¿Qué se requiere?

Los requisitos indispensables para desempeñar este rol son:


Formación: Ingeniería, Física, Matemáticas, Estadística
Conocimientos:
Modelos matemáticos con Python: Sklearn, Keras, modelos de optimización…
Experiencia:
Experiencia en entornos productivos de Machine Learning (al menos 1 año)
Experiencia en desarrollo de modelos con Python (al menos 1 año)


Además, se valorará:


Máster en Data science, IA
Conocimiento del mercado eléctrico y gasista


Y ahora seguro que te interesa saber qué es lo que te vamos a ofrecer

Ofrecemos un contrato indefinido.

Salario alineado a tu perfil y la posición que vas a ocupar. También disfrutarás de una variedad de beneficios sociales; por ejemplo, plan de pensiones, tarifa eléctrica de empleado, ayuda de estudios, ayuda al deporte, préstamos, ayuda económica si tienes hijos con discapacidad, retribución flexible (transporte, formación, seguro médico, guardería, compra de acciones de la empresa, comedor…)

Además, ofrecemos otros servicios como asesoramiento financiero, tarifas especiales con agencia de viajes, condiciones bancarias especiales por ser empleado de Endesa. Dependiendo del centro de trabajo, existe la opción de profesor de pilates, yoga, nutricionista, car sharing, aparcamiento gratuito…

Si crees que esta posición supone una oportunidad de desarrollo y un reto para ti, ¡no lo dudes e inscríbete!

Sólo tienes que aplicar a esta oferta de empleo. Si tu perfil encaja con lo que buscamos, Laura y Teresa del equipo de Atracción de Talento, valorarán tu candidatura y contactarán contigo, para conocerte más.

Por último, pero no menos importante, para nosotros la diversidad y la inclusión son puntos esenciales en nuestro día a día, por lo que en nuestros procesos de selección siempre contamos con todas las personas que muestran su interés y tienen el perfil que buscamos. Integramos e incluimos la diversidad de personas en todos sus sentidos.

Si quieres conocer un poco más sobre Endesa y Enel, te invitamos a que hagas click en estos enlaces:

Endesa: https://www.endesa.com/es/sobre-endesa/quienes-somos

Enel Green Power: https://www.enelgreenpower.com/es

Endesa X: https://www.endesax.com/es/es

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Hi! 👋🏼

At Shakers, we're on the lookout for an AI Engineer to take our Product team to the next level 🚀

1. Team and Role

If you have experience in developing AI systems, thrive in dynamic startup environments, and are ready to take your career to the next level, we want to hear from you.

This role offers the opportunity to gain full experience within a rapidly growing startup. We are a small, highly committed team with strong connections to other teams, so you'll have the chance to learn and grow quickly. There's a lot to be done! If you're excited about working in an innovative and fast-paced environment, collaborating with a talented team, and making a direct impact, this is your opportunity! 🤩



2. What you´ll be doing

Your day-to-day as an AI Engineer

As an AI Engineer, you will work hand in hand with one of our aquads to contribute to the key areas of the AI team, primarily:

Development of conversational systems: You will design, implement, and optimize AI products, chatbots, and virtual assistants that enhance the experience of our users.
Integration of third-party AI APIs: You will work with APIs such as OpenAI, Anthropic, Gemini AI, etc., integrating them effectively into our solutions.
Implementation of RAG systems (Retrieval Augmented Generation): You will create systems that combine knowledge bases with generative models for precise and contextualized responses.
Development with specialized libraries: You will use LangChain, LlamaIndex, LangFlow, and our own framework to build robust and scalable AI solutions.
Model evaluation and testing: You will implement evaluation methodologies to continuously measure and improve the performance of our models.
Cost and performance optimization: You will work on continuously improving our AI systems, balancing quality, speed, and operational costs.
Cross-disciplinary collaboration: You will work with product, engineering, and business teams to align AI solutions with strategic objectives.
Applied research: You will stay up-to-date with the latest advances in AI and evaluate new technologies for potential implementation.




3. What we´re looking for

We need someone who...

Has 2-4 years of experience programming AI solutions in Python, especially in startup or tech company environments.
Has experience with conversational systems and chatbots using large language models (LLMs).
Has worked with third-party AI APIs (OpenAI, Anthropic, Hugging Face, etc.).
Has experience in prompt engineering, dynamic prompt declaration, CoT, and self-evaluation methods.

It’s very important that you...

Are familiar with and have implemented RAG (Retrieval Augmented Generation) systems.
Have experience with libraries like LangChain, LlamaIndex, or LangFlow.
Follow best development practices: version control, documentation, unit testing, etc.
Are up-to-date with the latest trends and advancements in generative AI.

You’re perfect for us if you also have experience in...

Knowledge of Docker, CI/CD, deployment, and DevOps.
Knowledge of ML, predictive AI, recommendation systems.
Experience working with cloud providers such as AWS Bedrock, Microsoft Azure, or Gemini Vertex.
Experience building APIs with frameworks like FastAPI or similar.
Experience implementing testing and evaluation methodologies for AI models.




4. What's in it for you?

Compensation 💰

The salary range for this position is between 26.000€ and 46.000€ OTE (on target earnings) gross annual salary.

The salary consists of:

Between 26.000€ & 40.000€ fixed salary.
Up to 15% (6.000€) quarterly bonus based on performance & potential.

Why you´ll love working at Shakers 💚

Be part of a rapidly growing, internationally expanding startup. 🌍
Have an ambitious professional development plan to help you reach your full potential.
Enjoy an unbeatable team culture—ask anyone on our team!
Take advantage of our hybrid ful flex methodology: a mix of remote and in-office work, with our office located in the heart of Madrid, Calle Velázquez.
Perks include wellness programs, gym access, English classes, medical insurance, and more.

At the office... 📍

Organic fruit
Free caffeine and theine

5. Our recruitment process

As a startup, we are very agile and we like to see results quickly, which is why prioritize efficiency in our recruitment process.

Our goal is to have you onboard this May, so you can hit the ground running and make an impact from day one!


The Road to Joining Our Team


Round 1, Cultural Fit: Kick things off with an informal chat with our People & Culture team. Don’t worry—we just want to get to know you better, learn about your goals, hobbies, and more!
Round 2, Case Study & Technical Skills with Product Team: Join two members of our Product team for a deep dive into a case study. This is your chance to showcase your client management skills and demonstrate how you approach problem-solving.
Round 3, Meet the Team: Have a conversation with additional team members to further explore your skillset and ensure there's a great cultural fit. This is also your chance to ask questions and see how we collaborate.
Final check, CEO Chat: Meet Héctor, our CEO! He’s excited to connect with you, talk about Shakers’ future, and discuss your vision and expectations.
More about Shakers

At Shakers we imagine, design, and create the next-generation way of working.

Our vision is to be the leading community and platform in the world that helps companies work with freelance teams through our technology.

We are a 45-person, fast growing startup based in Madrid. It's the place for you if you're looking for a high-performance, very dynamic & technological environment surrounded by ambitious people!



Our DNA

At Shakers, we are obsessed with our values. Half of our bonuses are performance-based, and the other half come from embodying what it means to be a true Shaker!

WINNING TEAM 🏆

We all feel like part of a winning team—one that pushes boundaries, challenges the status quo, and moves the needle! We set ambitious goals and seek people who are driven to achieve them.

F1C10 💪🏼

We’re building an environment where fear doesn’t hold us back. Experimentation and learning from failure are part of our DNA. Fail fast, grow faster. Fail 1X, chase 10X. We value risk-takers who aren’t afraid to go big!

STAY HUMBLE 🤲🏼

We embrace a beginner’s mindset—always evolving, always learning, and always finding new solutions. At Shakers, humility combined with ambition fuels our success, and when we blend the two, the results are extraordinary!




A huge thanks for being interested in Shakers, we'd love to see you soon.

We are a 45-person, fast growing startup based in Madrid. It's the place for you if you're looking for a high-performance, very dynamic & technological environment surrounded by ambitious people!

Our DNA

At Shakers, we are obsessed with our values. Half of our bonuses are performance-based, and the other half come from embodying what it means to be a true Shaker!

WINNING TEAM 🏆

We all feel like part of a winning team—one that pushes boundaries, challenges the status quo, and moves the needle! We set ambitious goals and seek people who are driven to achieve them.

F1C10 💪🏼

We’re building an environment where fear doesn’t hold us back. Experimentation and learning from failure are part of our DNA. Fail fast, grow faster. Fail 1X, chase 10X. We value risk-takers who aren’t afraid to go big!

STAY HUMBLE 🤲🏼

We embrace a beginner’s mindset—always evolving, always learning, and always finding new solutions. At Shakers, humility combined with ambition fuels our success, and when we blend the two, the results are extraordinary!


A huge thanks for being interested in Shakers, we'd love to see you soon.

Title: Data scientist Junior & Senior
Description:
En QUANT AI LAB, seguimos creciendo para desarrollar las más avanzadas soluciones de inteligencia artificial y analíticas del mercado, siempre desde la vanguardia y unos conocimientos técnicos asentados. Unirse a QUANT AI LAB significa unirse a una aventura donde cada miembro es una parte importante de este proyecto, y cada parte resulta esencial para hacerlo realidad.




Como parte de nuestra continua apuesta por el progreso, estamos buscando reforzar nuestra división especializada en el desarrollo de soluciones analítico-cognitivas avanzadas y de vanguardia con la incorporación de varios perfiles de alto nivel, experiencia y conocimiento técnico en las líneas priorizadas más abajo.




El objetivo de esta división es doble: 1) contribuir al desarrollo de productos y soluciones propias de la compañía; y 2) apoyar y asistir a nuestros clientes en su apuesta por estas tecnologías, trabajando codo con codo en el desarrollo de soluciones innovadoras específicamente aplicadas a su contexto de negocio.




Estamos buscando reforzar nuestra división de élite de Inteligencia Artificial con varios Data Scientist con +3 años de experiencia, que posean un profundo y sólido conocimiento de las técnicas de inteligencia artificial, su diseño, conceptualización, desarrollo y puesta en producción. Estas personas se incorporarán a un equipo de élite y de grandes profesionales, para abordar proyectos avanzados de analítica e inteligencia artificial, trabajando con algunas de las tecnologías más avanzadas del momento, y con impacto internacional.




Entre las funciones de este equipo se encuentran:




Conceptualización, diseño e implementación de soluciones de inteligencia artificial con impacto directo en nuestros clientes.
Gestión de alcance, proyectos, desarrollos y entregables.
Implementación de las redes y algoritmos necesarios según los requerimientos del problema.
Participación de forma activa en el diseño y desarrollo de los procesos asociados a servicios analítico-cognitivos.
Participación en el diseño, desarrollo e integración.
Identificación de nuevas tecnologías, tendencias y soluciones que permitan ofrecer la máxima calidad y eficiencia de las soluciones.
Coordinación y colaboración con los equipos de Data Science para la implementación y puesta en producción de la solución.
Colaboración con el resto del equipo de Data e IA, formado por algunos de los mejores Data Scientist, Data Engineers, e investigadores del país.
Velar por la calidad de los desarrollos y limpieza del código (Clean Code), manteniendo los más altos estándares calidad y rigurosidad.
Proactividad y resolución de problemas.




Las competencias y conocimientos del candidato son:




Imprescindible




Preferible graduado en informática, o titulación técnica superior similar (matemáticas, físicas..).
Máster en Inteligencia Artificial. Se valora muy positivamente el doctorado.
Buen nivel de inglés, oral y escrito.
Experiencia demostrable y conocimientos sólidos en Inteligencia artificial.
Experiencia trabajando en la codificación y puesta en producción de modelos analíticos y de inteligencia artificial.
Altos estándares de codificación, gestión de código (GIT), etc.
Alto nivel de SQL y Python.
Experiencia demostrable en Cloud (AWS, Azure o GCP).










Capacidades blandas




Altas capacidades de comunicación, tanto verbal como escrita.
Capacidad de trabajo en equipo, y actitud resolutiva.
Proactividad
Experiencia tratando y comunicando con clientes, y presentación de resultados.
Dinamismo, agilidad resolutiva, y propositiva de soluciones.
Proactividad, alto nivel de compromiso y cumplimiento de entregables.
Ganas de aprender, colaborar y mejorar.




Todos los candidatos podrán ser sometidos a una prueba y entrevista técnica.







QUANT AI LAB, lo que le ofrecemos:




Contribuir al desarrollo de una empresa internacional en continuo crecimiento y desarrollando proyectos y productos de vanguardia.
Integrar un equipo multidisciplinar con formación profesional y académica de alto nivel, compuesto por algunos de los mayores expertos en el área de la inteligencia artificial, analítica avanzada y tratamiento del dato.
La oportunidad de trabajar directamente con clientes de talla internacional, y algunas de las mayores compañías del país y del mundo.
Un entorno de trabajo colaborativo, emprendedor y solidario, y un equipo joven y dinámico en el que todos se apoyan para crecer juntos.
Un ambiente divertido y agradable y eventos festivos (afterworks, seminarios...).
Contrato indefinido y un salario muy competitivo, que se determinará en función del perfil y la experiencia.







Si crees que puedes aportar a nuestra unidad analítica de vanguardia estaremos encantados de conocerte.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist (12-Month Contract, Fully Remote in the EU)




Compensation: $5,000 USD per month (Gross)




Job Overview:

We are seeking a Data Scientist to develop data-powered services that enhance our product, Subito, making it smarter and more intuitive. You will apply advanced analytics, statistical modeling, and machine learning techniques to extract valuable insights from vast datasets. Collaborating closely with cross-functional teams, you will design and deploy innovative solutions that optimize user experiences and drive key business metrics.




Key Responsibilities:

Drive data-driven product design by analyzing multiple data sources to generate insights and recommendations.
Develop, train, and deploy Machine Learning models to improve user engagement and optimize business performance.
Leverage diverse datasets (in collaboration with Data Engineers) to uncover patterns and deliver actionable intelligence.
Formulate hypotheses and design experiments to validate and refine model performance in production environments.
Democratize data across the organization by creating automated reports and dashboards for key stakeholders.




Experience & Qualifications:

3+ years of experience as a Data Scientist working with large datasets in production environments.
Strong foundation in applied statistical techniques, model building, and hypothesis testing.
Mastery of Python for data manipulation and ML frameworks (pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn, etc.), with familiarity in prototyping tools like Streamlit.
Hands-on experience designing, training, and deploying ML models at scale.
Advanced data extraction skills using SQL, Spark, and related technologies.
Familiarity with software development tools (Cloud infrastructure, Git, Docker, etc.) and best practices.
Experience building and optimizing large-scale data pipelines and ETL processes with Spark.
Knowledge of CI/CD for ML, experiment tracking, and model serving (e.g., MLflow, Kubeflow).
Git: Proficient in branching, merging, and pull request workflows.
Docker: Experience in containerizing ML solutions for efficient development and deployment.
Ability to lead projects from conception to production with minimal supervision.
Strong collaboration skills to work effectively with product managers, engineers, and other stakeholders.
Advanced English level (written and verbal communication).




Nice to Have:

Terraform: Basic exposure to Infrastructure as Code principles for automating resource provisioning.

Title: AI (Artificial Intelligence) model analyst
Description:
GROUP BNP PARIBAS

BNP Paribas Group is the top bank in the European Union and a major international banking establishment. It has close to 185,000 employees in 65 countries. In Spain we are more than 5,100 employees within 13 business lines.

RISK HUB

RISK is an integrated and independent control function of the BNP Paribas Group. It is the second line of defense on the risk management activities of the Group which are under its direct responsibilities, including credit and counterparty risk, market risk, funding and liquidity risk, interest rate and foreign exchange risks in the banking book, insurance risk, operational risk, and environmental and social risks.

RISK aims at being a partner of the businesses by contributing to their sustainable development, but also a gatekeeper to ensure risks taken remain compatible with the Group’s Risk Appetite and its strategy.

RISK Iberian Hub Madrid is a transversal platform servicing the RISK Function by covering added-value activities around credit risk, market risk, operational risk and data protection. Offering a wide range of services to RISK teams, from consulting to cyber security going through data analysis, modelling or artificial intelligence.

About The Job

You will join the Global Practice RISK IRC (Independent Review and Control) responsible for:


Independent model validation (RISK IR);
Leading the Group's Model Risk governance (RISK IRCO);
Exercising LoD2 on operational risk generated by the RISK Function processes (RISK ORM RISK);
Participating in validation projects for the BNP Paribas group spread across 9 countries (Europe and North America).


The position is within RISK IR and is located at Millénaire 1 in fully renovated premises, eligible for teleworking according to the Group's current agreements.

What about your daily life?

As an AI (Artificial Intelligence) Model Analyst, you will be in charge of the following tasks:


Conducting independent evaluations of the AI models used within BNP Paribas, specifically verifying:
their conceptual robustness,
the validity of their results,
the model performance monitoring system,
the implementation and any other relevant aspect of the modeling affecting the models' use,
Documenting the work and defending the conclusions before a validation committee,
Leveraging your expertise and the independent reviews conducted to keep the Group's AI validation standards up to date,
Collaborating with other RISK IRC streams to benefit from their business expertise,
Working closely with BNPP's data science teams to participate in AI tools experimentation.


And then what?

As part of the Group RISK Function within BNP Paribas’ extensive network of quantitative analysts specializing in risk modelling, you will have a key role to play in understanding and modelling multiple risks to which the Bank is exposed.

In addition, with the focus on compliance with regulatory requirements, you will be involved in future internal or external audit missions where your expertise, communication and analytical skills will be valuable assets. Such an environment guarantees you good prospects for rich and motivating projects.

By its cross-functional nature, this position will enable you to increase your technical expertise, your experience in managing structuring projects for the Group and your versatility and naturally leads to numerous career development opportunities within the RISK Function but also to the Business Lines.

And you? SKILLS

In-depth knowledge of quantitative analysis and AI (time series analysis, data science techniques, statistical inference, segmentation, etc.).

TECHNICAL


Proficiency in programming with a language such as Python or R.
Experience with machine learning libraries such as Scikit-Learn, LightGBM, Tensorflow, or PyTorch.
Experience with version control tools (Git).


TRANSVERSAL


You are adaptable to changes and also comfortable with oral and written communication to convey your messages clearly to various audiences.
You possess strong analytical and synthesis skills, are thorough, curious, proactive, and open to new working methods to enhance our practices and fulfill our missions.
Your command of English is advanced, both written and spoken.


Benefits


Training programs, career plans and internal mobility opportunities, national and international thanks to our presence in different countries.
Diversity and Inclusion Committee that ensures an inclusive work environment. In recent years, several employee communities have been created to organize diversity and inclusion awareness actions (PRIDE, We Generations and MixCity).
Corporate volunteering program (1 Million Hours 2 Help) in which employees can dedicate time out of their working hours to volunteer activities.
Flexible compensation plan.
Hybrid telecommuting model (50%).
32 vacation days.


Diversity and inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas Group in Spain is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

Title: AI Researcher (100% Remote - Spain)
Description:
Join Tether and Shape the Future of Digital Finance

At Tether, we’re not just building products, we’re pioneering a global financial revolution. Our cutting-edge solutions empower businesses—from exchanges and wallets to payment processors and ATMs—to seamlessly integrate reserve-backed tokens across blockchains. By harnessing the power of blockchain technology, Tether enables you to store, send, and receive digital tokens instantly, securely, and globally, all at a fraction of the cost. Transparency is the bedrock of everything we do, ensuring trust in every transaction.

Innovate with Tether

Tether Finance: Our innovative product suite features the world’s most trusted stablecoin, USDT, relied upon by hundreds of millions worldwide, alongside pioneering digital asset tokenization services.

But that’s just the beginning:

Tether Power: Driving sustainable growth, our energy solutions optimize excess power for Bitcoin mining using eco-friendly practices in state-of-the-art, geo-diverse facilities.

Tether Data: Fueling breakthroughs in AI and peer-to-peer technology, we reduce infrastructure costs and enhance global communications with cutting-edge solutions like KEET, our flagship app that redefines secure and private data sharing.

Tether Education: Democratizing access to top-tier digital learning, we empower individuals to thrive in the digital and gig economies, driving global growth and opportunity.

Tether Evolution: At the intersection of technology and human potential, we are pushing the boundaries of what is possible, crafting a future where innovation and human capabilities merge in powerful, unprecedented ways.

Why Join Us?

Our team is a global talent powerhouse, working remotely from every corner of the world. If you’re passionate about making a mark in the fintech space, this is your opportunity to collaborate with some of the brightest minds, pushing boundaries and setting new standards. We’ve grown fast, stayed lean, and secured our place as a leader in the industry.

If you have excellent English communication skills and are ready to contribute to the most innovative platform on the planet, Tether is the place for you.

Are you ready to be part of the future?

About The Job

At Tether, we're committed to making advanced AI technologies more accessible. Thanks to its investment in AI infrastructure, starting from Northern Data, Tether is now in a prime position to tackle ambitious AI projects. Our goal is to build the next generation of AI models, leading innovation in AI, through an accessible, transparent and privacy preserving approach.

This role is uniquely positioned to oversee the creation and optimization of AI solutions across the spectrum from large-scale models designed for advanced applications to smaller, highly performant models tailored for efficiency on edge devices such as mobile phones and laptops. Your leadership will guide our team in pushing the boundaries of AI, making high-performance AI technologies accessible and efficient for personal use while setting new industry standards for innovation and utility.

What You'll Do:


Research and Development of multimodal AI models that set new industry standards.
Collaborate with other departments to ensure our AI models are effectively integrated into market-driven solutions.
A degree in Computer Science. Ideally PhD in NLP, Machine Learning, or a related field, complemented by a solid track record in AI R&D(with good publications in A* conferences).
Experience building a LLM or other large models from scratch including writing model code, gathering training data, optimizing training and inference.
Strong experience in NLP, multimodal learning, proficient in TensorFlow, PyTorch, JAX and CUDA toolkit.
Excellent programming skills in Python.

  • Collaborate with other departments to ensure our AI models are effectively integrated into market-driven solutions.
  • A degree in Computer Science. Ideally PhD in NLP, Machine Learning, or a related field, complemented by a solid track record in AI R&D(with good publications in A* conferences).
  • Experience building a LLM or other large models from scratch including writing model code, gathering training data, optimizing training and inference.
  • Strong experience in NLP, multimodal learning, proficient in TensorFlow, PyTorch, JAX and CUDA toolkit.
  • Excellent programming skills in Python.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
📌 Job Description: Data Scientist (ML & LLMs)

Location: Spain

Working hours: Ability to work EST hours.

We are seeking a Data Scientist with strong expertise in Machine Learning, LLMs, and AI-driven solutions. The ideal candidate will have a solid foundation in statistical models, ML techniques, and hands-on experience with LLM development. This role requires proficiency in Python, Docker, and GitLab CI/CD, with GCP as a mandatory skill.

🛠️ Responsibilities

Develop, train, and optimize traditional machine learning models for data analysis and predictive insights.
Apply expertise in LLMs, prompt engineering, and AI model optimization to build and refine AI applications.
Utilize Python, Docker, and GitLab CI/CD for model automation, testing, and deployment.
(Preferred) Implement FastAPI for building scalable APIs and integrating ML models into production environments.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive AI-powered innovations and ensure project success.
Maintain a high standard of coding, version control, and model performance evaluation.

🎯 Requirements

5+ years of experience in Data Science, Machine Learning, or AI.
Hands-on experience with LLMs, AI model optimization & prompt engineering.
GCP proficiency is required.
Strong expertise in Python, Docker, and GitLab CI/CD for model development.
Knowledge of statistical models and data science principles.
(Preferred) FastAPI experience for API development & deployment.
Strong problem-solving and teamwork skills.
Al least Upper-Intermediate level of English.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
At TomTom we’re seeking a Data Scientist to join our Maps Quality and Product Insight team in Madrid. As part of the team, you will help TomTom deliver the most up-to-date, accurate and detailed maps and locations services for the hundreds of millions of drivers and users of our maps and products around the world and that will enable the future of autonomous driving.

The Maps Quality and Insight team is focused on providing state-of-the-art data & analytics solutions that enable fast and cost-effective data-driven strategic decision making within TomTom and for our customers and partners.  

The impact you'll make


Drive strategic business decisions with insights obtained by manipulating large volumes of data from a variety of different sources:  system logs, satellite imagery, vertical imagery, street level imagery, GPS traces, etc. individually and by fusing several combinations of these sources
Design, develop and maintain data processing pipelines to use these data sources individually or combined and to predict various map features and attributes by applying statistical models/ ML / AI models  
State the quality level of our maps via statistical experiments that help us understand where we are and why, and deliver effective insights that help drive our map editing strategy 
Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model and system performance and data accuracy 
Collaborate with teams from diverse backgrounds (e.g., data scientists, software engineers, product managers, map and GIS experts …) across the company and with our customers on projects and knowledge sharing 


What you'll need


Minimum 3+ years of experience working as a Data Scientist or Software Engineer (with relevant experience in data analytics projects)
Bachelor’s/Masters in Computer science, Mathematics, Statistics, or equivalent field 
Good communications skills in English
Strong problem-solving skills
To be team-oriented – to be able to communicate with other team members, express doubts, provide and accept constructive feedback
To be passionate about programming and have a solid foundation of software development, and be always eager to learn and improve your skills
Fair statistical knowledge and expertise in designing and testing experiments and drawing conclusions under uncertainty (sampling strategies, robust statistical estimation,...)
Experience in at least one object-oriented language – Python is a must, PySpark and Scala is a plus
Experience in various ML / AI techniques and frameworks
Knowledge of SQL and databases
Experience in processing and analysing data to draw insights and produce visualizations (data storitelling)
A passion for learning new technologies and techniques and a curiosity for exploring new possibilities and challenges


What Is Nice To Have


Work experience in Big Data and cloud ecosystems (e.g., Spark, Databricks, Azure, AWS, GCP…).
Prior experience with working with geospatial and map data and/or with NoSQL databases

Title: Data Scientist Manager
Description:
About Us

IDOVEN is a health tech startup seeking to prevent cardiac disease through AI. With our breakthrough AI-based electrocardiogram analysis platform, we work with physicians and healthcare leaders to enable early detection and diagnosis at scale.

This is a unique opportunity. With the backing of the best investors in the industry, the European Innovation Council (EIC) and Horizon 2020 European Commission, you'll have the responsibility and resources to shape the creation of a game-changing product that can save millions of lives.

Our technology is recognized with the European Seal of Excellence, supported by EIT Health (a network of best-in-class health innovators backed by the EU), and received the Healthy Longevity Catalyst Award from the U.S. National Academy of Medicine. In 2021, we were awarded at South Summit as Most Disruptive Startup and Best Health Startup. We are one of the most promising European technology companies to watch.

About The Role

We are seeking a highly motivated and innovative Deep Learning Specialist to lead the development and optimization of our AI-powered ECG analysis platform. This role demands deep expertise in deep learning modeling, with a proven ability to design and implement custom models from scratch. You will play a crucial part in advancing the state-of-the-art in cardiac diagnostics by exploring and implementing cutting-edge Deep Learning techniques.

Responsibilities:


Lead and mentor a team of data scientists and engineers, providing technical guidance and fostering professional growth
Continuously research and integrate emerging Deep Learning techniques, including representation learning, self-supervised learning, generative models, and novel neural network architectures, to drive innovation
Analyze, enhance, and scale Deep Learning models for complex signal processing tasks, ensuring high accuracy, efficiency, and generalization
Oversee the implementation of data balancing, augmentation, and synthetic data generation techniques to improve model robustness
Drive model optimization efforts, leveraging techniques such as fine-tuning, distillation, quantization, and distributed training for improved performance
Spearhead automation initiatives for data preprocessing, model training, and deployment pipelines to accelerate development cycles and ensure efficiency
Collaborate closely with engineers, domain experts, and stakeholders to ensure technical solutions align with real-world applications and business goals
Advocate for best practices in AI model development, validation, and deployment, ensuring high-quality and scalable solutions
Stay abreast of the latest advancements in Deep Learning, signal processing, and AI to maintain a cutting-edge approach to research and development



Requirements

Desired Qualifications:


Master's or PhD in a quantitative field with a focus on Deep Learning
6+ years of experience in developing, optimizing, and deploying Deep Learning models in production
Strong expertise in signal processing, data balancing, model debugging, and performance optimization
Proficiency in TensorFlow or PyTorch, Python, and ML libraries (NumPy, Scikit-learn, Pandas)
Experience leading and mentoring teams, driving collaboration, and managing machine learning pipelines
Strong project management and communication skills, with the ability to align technical goals with business objectives


Preferred Qualifications:


Experience with large-scale distributed systems and cloud-based ML infrastructures (AWS, GCP, Azure)
Knowledge of MLOps, model interpretability, fairness, and bias mitigation techniques
Experience in cross-functional collaboration with product managers and engineers
Contributions to Deep Learning research (publications, open-source projects)



Additional Skills


Knowledge of cloud computing platforms and distributed training
Contributions to research publications or open-source projects in relevant fields
Experience with processing of ECG signals



Benefits

🚀 Be part of one of the most disruptive startups in HealthTech and AI and make a difference

🏆 Personal and professional growth as part of a fast-growing, international team

🎧No corners cut in having the best tech equipment to do your job

🙋 Unlimited remote working environment, where you can choose to work from home and attend our Madrid office whenever you want to

📚Learning and development opportunities and training budget

💸 Flexible Remuneration

👩🏻‍⚕️ Health Insurance

🏋 Access to Wellhub (Gympass), empowering your physical and mental wellness!

🖥️ Remote Work Allowance for your home office setup!

🌴 23 holidays, your birthday off, and December 24th and 31st half days to celebrate!

😎 Regular team events and Thursday happy hours

And much more!

At IDOVEN, we believe in hiring top talented people like you - ambitious, forward thinkers who want to make a difference in the world and have an impact.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
As a Data Scientist , you will have the opportunity to manipulate large data sets, integrate diverse data sources, data types and data structures into solutions under management guidance. You will build experience developing analytical approaches to meet business requirements, which involves translating requests into use cases, test cases, preparation of training data sets and iterative algorithm development.

What You Will Do


Utilize combined knowledge of data structures, analytics, algorithms/models, and strong computer science fundamentals to prepare datasets, conduct analytics, and develop deployable solutions with guidance from more senior resources.
Leverage knowledge of data structures and algorithms to analyze and prepare data for analysis, assembling data from standard and new data sources.
Able to analyze and prepare complex and new data sources and incorporate them into analytical solutions.
Works on moderate complexity tasks in problems often within multiple business or analytical domains, collaborating with other teams to develop predictive models, risk assessments, fraud detection, recommendation engines, etc.
Package, summarize and visualize analytical findings and results for management.
Evaluate the work of peer and/or junior data scientists to ensure high quality solutions.


What Experience You Need


BS degree in a STEM major or equivalent discipline.
2-5 years of experience in a related analytical role, including experience with the design and development of predictive models.
Cloud certification strongly preferred.
Additional role-based certifications may be required depending upon region/BU requirements.


What Could Set You Apart


Master’s degree or higher in Mathematics, Computer Science , Engineering, Operations Research, Statistics or other related discipline a definite plus.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Description

Ryanair Labs is the technology brand of Ryanair, a start-up inside a corporation and a state of-the-art digital & IT innovation hub creating Europe’s Leading Travel Experience for customers. More than 600+ IT enthusiasts are working on 30+ projects with a collaboration of our Dublin, Madrid, Wroclaw and Portugal Labs teams and are making your travel experience unique. As a result of our continued expansion, we want to hear from the best IT experts the European market has to offer to join our Labs.

The Role

We are looking for a Data Scientist to join a multi-disciplinary team tackling complex, unsolved challenges with the potential for real business impact across the Ryanair network. You will own your work from ideation and problem definition to final implementation, driving solutions for high-impact commercial projects.

Requirements


Relevant work experience.
Bachelor’s degree, or equivalent experience in a quantitative field (Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Artificial Intelligence, etc.).
Proven problem solver – the ability to come up with unique solutions to unique problems.
Professional experience in working with large data sets.
Strong programming skills in Python and knowledge of analytical packages (pandas, NumPy, SciPy, scikit-learn etc.) and SQL.
Strong statistical background – Ability to back claims in your findings with rigorous statistical analysis.
Following good coding practises (OOP, code review, unit testing, PEP8 guidelines etc.).
At least basic knowledge of code versioning systems (e.g. Git) and DevOps tools (e.g. Docker, CI/CD).
Broad knowledge of Machine Learning topics (clustering, forecasting, classification, regression, anomaly detection).
Experiment design knowledge – Ability to set up an experiment to measure the impact of your models against company goals.
Proven track record of being able to deliver insight with the ability to visualize and explain a model to a target audience.
Experience implementing real-world projects in commercial area.
Fluent in English


Nice To Have


Experience in pricing.
Experience with real-time data projects.
Experience with PySpark.
Experience in cloud technologies (AWS, Databricks, Azure …).
Experience in causal inference.


Benefits


We promote innovation, all our teams are Agile and several PoCs of new technologies or innovative ideas are launched every week.
A competitive but flexible technical career plan.
We believe in an hybrid working model, you can work up to three days per week remote, but you are also going to enjoy the excellent work environment at our modern offices in the heart of Madrid.
Optional discounts on health insurances (various companies).
Travel discounts, of course!


Competencies

Dependability

Communication

Interpersonal Skills
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
At TomTom we’re seeking a Data Scientist to join our Maps Quality and Product Insight team in Madrid. As part of the team, you will help TomTom deliver the most up-to-date, accurate and detailed maps and locations services for the hundreds of millions of drivers and users of our maps and products around the world and that will enable the future of autonomous driving.

The Maps Quality and Insight team is focused on providing state-of-the-art data & analytics solutions that enable fast and cost-effective data-driven strategic decision making within TomTom and for our customers and partners.  

The impact you'll make


Drive strategic business decisions with insights obtained by manipulating large volumes of data from a variety of different sources:  system logs, satellite imagery, vertical imagery, street level imagery, GPS traces, etc. individually and by fusing several combinations of these sources
Design, develop and maintain data processing pipelines to use these data sources individually or combined and to predict various map features and attributes by applying statistical models/ ML / AI models  
State the quality level of our maps via statistical experiments that help us understand where we are and why, and deliver effective insights that help drive our map editing strategy 
Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model and system performance and data accuracy 
Collaborate with teams from diverse backgrounds (e.g., data scientists, software engineers, product managers, map and GIS experts …) across the company and with our customers on projects and knowledge sharing 


What you'll need


Minimum 3+ years of experience working as a Data Scientist or Software Engineer (with relevant experience in data analytics projects)
Bachelor’s/Masters in Computer science, Mathematics, Statistics, or equivalent field 
Good communications skills in English
Strong problem-solving skills
To be team-oriented – to be able to communicate with other team members, express doubts, provide and accept constructive feedback
To be passionate about programming and have a solid foundation of software development, and be always eager to learn and improve your skills
Fair statistical knowledge and expertise in designing and testing experiments and drawing conclusions under uncertainty (sampling strategies, robust statistical estimation,...)
Experience in at least one object-oriented language – Python is a must, PySpark and Scala is a plus
Experience in various ML / AI techniques and frameworks
Knowledge of SQL and databases
Experience in processing and analysing data to draw insights and produce visualizations (data storitelling)
A passion for learning new technologies and techniques and a curiosity for exploring new possibilities and challenges


What Is Nice To Have


Work experience in Big Data and cloud ecosystems (e.g., Spark, Databricks, Azure, AWS, GCP…).
Prior experience with working with geospatial and map data and/or with NoSQL databases


What We Offer

A competitive compensation package, of course.

Time and resources to grow and develop, including a personal development budget and paid leave for learning days, as well as paid access to e-learning resources such as O’Reilly and LinkedIn Learning.

Time to support life outside of work, with enhanced parental leave plus paid leave to care for loved ones and volunteer in local communities.

Work flexibility, where TomTom’ers, in agreement with their manager and team, use both the office and home to focus, collaborate, learn and socialize. It’s all about getting the best out of both worlds – we ask TomTom’ers to come to the office two days a week, and the remaining three are free to be worked in either location.

Improve your home office with a setup budget and get extra support with a monthly allowance.

Enjoy options to work from your home country and abroad for a set number of days each year, to visit family and friends, or to simply explore the world we’re mapping.

Take the holidays you want with a competitive holiday plan, plus an extra day off to celebrate your birthday.

Join annual events like our Hackathon and DevDays to bring your ideas to life with talented teammates from around the world.

Become a part of our inclusive global culture and have the chance to collaborate with a diverse community – we have over 80 nationalities at TomTom!

Find out more about our global benefits and enjoy additional local benefits tailored to your location.

Meet your team

We’re Maps, a global team within TomTom’s Location Technology Products technical unit. Our team is driven to deliver the most up-to-date, accurate and detailed maps for hundreds of millions of users around the world. Joining our team, you’ll continuously innovate our mapmaking processes, directly contributing to our vision: engineering the world's most trusted and useful map.

At TomTom...

You’ll help people find their way in the world. In 2004, TomTom revolutionized how the world moves with the introduction of the first portable navigation device. Now, we intend to do it again by engineering the first-ever real-time map, the smartest and most useful map on the planet.

Work with a team of 3,700 unique, curious and passionate problem-solvers. Together, we’ll open up a world of possibilities for car manufacturers, enterprises and developers to help people understand and get closer to the world around them.

After you apply

Our recruitment team will work hard to give you a meaningful experience throughout your journey with us, no matter the outcome. Your application will be screened closely and you can rest assured that all follow-up actions will be thorough, from assessments and interviews all the way through onboarding. To find out more about our application process, check out our hiring FAQs.

TomTom is an equal opportunity employer

TomTom is where you can find your place in the world. Every day we welcome, nurture and celebrate differences. Why? Because your uniqueness is what makes you, you. No matter your culture or background, you’ll find your impact at TomTom. Research also shows that sometimes women and underrepresented communities can be hesitant to apply for positions unless they believe they meet 100% of the criteria. If you can relate to this, please know that we’d love to hear from you.
Show more
HTML:
At TomTom we’re seeking a Data Scientist to join our Maps Quality and Product Insight team in Madrid. As part of the team, you will help TomTom deliver the most up-to-date, accurate and detailed maps and locations services for the hundreds of millions of drivers and users of our maps and products around the world and that will enable the future of autonomous driving.

The Maps Quality and Insight team is focused on providing state-of-the-art data & analytics solutions that enable fast and cost-effective data-driven strategic decision making within TomTom and for our customers and partners.  

The impact you'll make

  • Drive strategic business decisions with insights obtained by manipulating large volumes of data from a variety of different sources:  system logs, satellite imagery, vertical imagery, street level imagery, GPS traces, etc. individually and by fusing several combinations of these sources
  • Design, develop and maintain data processing pipelines to use these data sources individually or combined and to predict various map features and attributes by applying statistical models/ ML / AI models  
  • State the quality level of our maps via statistical experiments that help us understand where we are and why, and deliver effective insights that help drive our map editing strategy 
  • Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model and system performance and data accuracy 
  • Collaborate with teams from diverse backgrounds (e.g., data scientists, software engineers, product managers, map and GIS experts …) across the company and with our customers on projects and knowledge sharing 

What you'll need

  • Minimum 3+ years of experience working as a Data Scientist or Software Engineer (with relevant experience in data analytics projects)
  • Bachelor’s/Masters in Computer science, Mathematics, Statistics, or equivalent field 
  • Good communications skills in English
  • Strong problem-solving skills
  • To be team-oriented – to be able to communicate with other team members, express doubts, provide and accept constructive feedback
  • To be passionate about programming and have a solid foundation of software development, and be always eager to learn and improve your skills
  • Fair statistical knowledge and expertise in designing and testing experiments and drawing conclusions under uncertainty (sampling strategies, robust statistical estimation,...)
  • Experience in at least one object-oriented language – Python is a must, PySpark and Scala is a plus
  • Experience in various ML / AI techniques and frameworks
  • Knowledge of SQL and databases
  • Experience in processing and analysing data to draw insights and produce visualizations (data storitelling)
  • A passion for learning new technologies and techniques and a curiosity for exploring new possibilities and challenges

What Is Nice To Have

  • Work experience in Big Data and cloud ecosystems (e.g., Spark, Databricks, Azure, AWS, GCP…).
  • Prior experience with working with geospatial and map data and/or with NoSQL databases

What We Offer

A competitive compensation package, of course.

Time and resources to grow and develop, including a personal development budget and paid leave for learning days, as well as paid access to e-learning resources such as O’Reilly and LinkedIn Learning.

Time to support life outside of work, with enhanced parental leave plus paid leave to care for loved ones and volunteer in local communities.

Work flexibility, where TomTom’ers, in agreement with their manager and team, use both the office and home to focus, collaborate, learn and socialize. It’s all about getting the best out of both worlds – we ask TomTom’ers to come to the office two days a week, and the remaining three are free to be worked in either location.

Improve your home office with a setup budget and get extra support with a monthly allowance.

Enjoy options to work from your home country and abroad for a set number of days each year, to visit family and friends, or to simply explore the world we’re mapping.

Take the holidays you want with a competitive holiday plan, plus an extra day off to celebrate your birthday.

Join annual events like our Hackathon and DevDays to bring your ideas to life with talented teammates from around the world.

Become a part of our inclusive global culture and have the chance to collaborate with a diverse community – we have over 80 nationalities at TomTom!

Find out more about our global benefits and enjoy additional local benefits tailored to your location.

Meet your team

We’re Maps, a global team within TomTom’s Location Technology Products technical unit. Our team is driven to deliver the most up-to-date, accurate and detailed maps for hundreds of millions of users around the world. Joining our team, you’ll continuously innovate our mapmaking processes, directly contributing to our vision: engineering the world's most trusted and useful map.

At TomTom...

You’ll help people find their way in the world. In 2004, TomTom revolutionized how the world moves with the introduction of the first portable navigation device. Now, we intend to do it again by engineering the first-ever real-time map, the smartest and most useful map on the planet.

Work with a team of 3,700 unique, curious and passionate problem-solvers. Together, we’ll open up a world of possibilities for car manufacturers, enterprises and developers to help people understand and get closer to the world around them.

After you apply

Our recruitment team will work hard to give you a meaningful experience throughout your journey with us, no matter the outcome. Your application will be screened closely and you can rest assured that all follow-up actions will be thorough, from assessments and interviews all the way through onboarding. To find out more about our application process, check out our hiring FAQs.

TomTom is an equal opportunity employer

TomTom is where you can find your place in the world. Every day we welcome, nurture and celebrate differences. Why? Because your uniqueness is what makes you, you. No matter your culture or background, you’ll find your impact at TomTom. Research also shows that sometimes women and underrepresented communities can be hesitant to apply for positions unless they believe they meet 100% of the criteria. If you can relate to this, please know that we’d love to hear from you.

Title: Data Scientist (ML & IA)
Description:
SegurCaixa Adeslas es la compañía No Vida líder en España en seguros de salud, integrada en el Grupo Mutua Madrileña y participada por CaixaBank.




En los últimos años se ha convertido en una entidad de referencia gracias a la implantación de un modelo de negocio basado en el crecimiento sostenido y rentable, que sitúa al cliente en el centro de la estrategia. A través de su acuerdo de bancaseguros con CaixaBank, SegurCaixa Adeslas comercializa sus productos en la mayor red bancaria de España. Adicionalmente, la aseguradora cuenta con una red tradicional con más de 4.000 puntos de venta y atención al cliente.




Estamos convencid@s de que las personas son el principal valor de nuestra compañía y por eso SegurCaixa Adeslas se muestra absolutamente comprometida con la igualdad de oportunidades entre hombres y mujeres. Nuestro Plan de Igualdad persigue hacer efectivo este principio y por ello, el proceso de selección de nuestras ofertas garantiza la igualdad de oportunidades a todas las candidaturas.




¿Qué buscamos?




El equipo de Analítica Avanzada quiere incorporar un/a Senior Data Scientist, que nos ayude al posicionamiento del área como un elemento diferenciador dentro de la compañía, aportando soluciones de analítica avanzada que tengan impacto real en el negocio.




En tu día a día, asumirás el reto de gestionar proyectos, diseñar y construir soluciones de Analítica Avanzada, aplicando técnicas de ML, IA, etc. con impacto directo en negocio.




FUNCIONES




Diseñar, desarrollar y productivizar soluciones analíticas avanzadas basadas en datos para ayudar a la toma de decisiones, cumpliendo con los requerimientos de negocio.
Liderar el diseño, análisis y preprocesamiento de datos, junto con los/as Data Engineer, para alimentar los modelos de ML.
Creación de escenarios de simulación y análisis del impacto esperado por los diferentes modelos en los resultados.
Comunicación con Negocio constante, para identificar las necesidades de negocio y dar respuestas a los problemas de negocio usando análisis y técnicas de modelado sobre los datos.
Seguimiento, control y análisis continuo de resultados de los principales indicadores de negocio impactados por las soluciones analíticas y de las métricas técnicas asociadas, en el marco de la mejora continua.
Evaluar y seleccionar los modelos estadísticos, reglas o soluciones más adecuados para cada caso de uso.
Participar en el ciclo de productivización MLOps.




REQUISITOS




Licenciado/a o Grado en Estadística / Matemáticas / Actuariales con máster en Data Science.
Experiencia: 3-5 años experiencia trabajando como Data Scientist diseñando e implementando técnicas de ML / IA con Python.
Valorable experiencia en sector seguros




Informática y aplicaciones:




Gran dominio y experiencia en Python
Dominio de librerías de IA y ML
Conocimiento y experiencia en entorno Cloud, Azure / Databricks
Necesario: Gran conocimiento y comprensión de métodos de Machine Learning







¿Eres la persona que buscamos?

En @SegurCaixaAdeslas te estamos esperando ¡¡Únete a nosotros/as!!

En @SegurCaixaAdeslas te estamos esperando ¡¡Únete a nosotros/as!!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Job's summary

We are looking for an experienced (at least three years, preferably five or more) Machine Learning Engineer to join the Team. As a Machine Learning Engineer at Resilience you will have the opportunity to work on the entire data cycle, exploring, enriching, preparing, analyzing, modeling and industrializing new features based on ML algorithms. You will basically participate to enrich all of our products thanks to AI.

Il you are passionate about extracting value from data, finding the most adapted models and bringing them to industrialization to answer business challenges, you are in the right place!

How your job participates to make Resilience successful:

As a patients-centric company we believe that new machine learning techniques can definitively participates to improve their daily life. At Resilience, we all share one global common objective and you will participate to achieve it: reinvent care and improve patients quality of life.

What your day to day looks like:

Most of your time will be dedicated to the improvement and enrichment of an existing product using NLP techniques and more to solve data usability issues within our healthcare system. For this you will have to design solutions that are both pragmatic and constrained for short term efficiency, using more classical approaches, as well as ambitious and more exploratory for mid/long term plans.

To do this you will be sharing thoughts and code with the rest of the team (during the usual SCRUM ceremonies or not) as well as external contributors (like M.D. or product managers). You can also expect to be exposed to various other subjects (clinical studies, other features...) as the team participates in several different efforts within the company (e.g. patients' adverse events anticipation).

Lastly, the company operates fully remotely with offices in various hubs (such as Paris, Biarritz, etc.). Although the team is entirely based in Paris, expect a significant amount of asynchronous communication.

About The Team

The Team is currently composed of Machine Learning Engineers and Data Scientists. You will have the opportunity to collaborate with many different teams across R&D (Product, Data Engineering, SRE…) but not only (Medical…).

Targeted profile

⚙️ You are the good person if you already have experience with:


Python and standard ML packages (pandas, numpy, scikit-learn etc)
classical NLP projects and with some of the most common packages (spaCy)
Traditional statistical learning as well as machine learning techniques, inc. supervised and unsupervised learning
Sourcing, cleaning, manipulating and analyzing data
Models industrialization, e.g. putting models in production and monitoring their performance


🙂 You are the good person if you are:


Pragmatic, analytic, solution-oriented, proactive mindset
Strong team player and ease collaboration with business teams
Interested by health ecosystem
Good communicator and able to adapt your speech according to the audience, both written and oral in French and English.


It is even better if you:


Are able to go beyond his regular technical scope if necessary
Are familiar with web API framework (FastAPI or equivalent) and serving ML models to applications
Are proficiency in DevOps environment : versioning (Git), CI/CD, test coverage, containers etc.
Are proficiency in MLOps and ML Platform : experiment trackers, orchestrators, monitoring & measurement, data lineage etc
Have former experience processing non-structured health data
Are familiar with common healthcare standards and frameworks (CIM10, OMOP...)
Have practical knowledge in one of the popular machine learning and deep learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, etc)
Have knowledge of experience with front-end data visualization


Recruitment process


Interview 1 with Ivan (Data & Machine Learning Lead, your future manager) or Jullian (Head of data) - to make sure you are all aligned on the offered position
Technical Async Test with Ivan: coding test
Technical Live Test with Ivan & Jullian: system design test
Interview 2 with Anthony (onPrem VP) - to ensure global fit
Interview 3 with Raphaëlle (Product Data Lead) - to assess collaboration between Product & Business teams
Interview 4 with Alice, talent manager - to share about company’s culture


GDPR : Your personal data will be processed for the purposes of recruitment related activities, which include setting up and conducting interviews and tests for applicants, evaluating and assessing the results thereto, and as is otherwise needed in the recruitment and hiring processes. They will be available only for people involved in the process and erased after 2 years of inactivity.

Under GDPR and as Resilience attach great importance to privacy, please note that you have the right to request access to your personal data, to request that your personal data be rectified or erased. The Data Protection Officer can be contacted at privacy@resilience.care

For more information, please check our privacy policy.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
En PALATIN conectamos profesionales con nuevas oportunidades.




Actualmente, buscamos un Data Engineer con experiencia en Spark y Scala para formar parte de un equipo dinámico y altamente cualificado. Si buscas un entorno en el que puedas crecer profesionalmente y afrontar nuevos retos en el ámbito del Big Data y Cloud, esta es tu oportunidad.




¿Qué harás en este rol?




Diseñar y desarrollar arquitecturas de procesamiento de datos en tiempo real y por lotes utilizando Scala/Python y Apache Spark.
Trabajar en estrecha colaboración con diferentes equipos para definir y transformar los requisitos de datos en soluciones técnicas eficientes.
Optimizar sistemas de procesamiento de datos para garantizar su rendimiento y escalabilidad.
Implementar prácticas avanzadas para garantizar la integridad y calidad de los datos.
Mantenerse al día con las últimas tendencias en tecnologías de Big Data y Cloud.




¿Qué buscamos en ti?




Formación en Ingeniería Informática, Ciencias de la Computación o un campo afín.
Al menos 2 años de experiencia trabajando con Scala en entornos de Big Data.
Conocimientos sólidos en Apache Spark y desarrollo de pipelines de datos a gran escala.
Experiencia en el diseño y construcción de procesos ETL/ELT en la nube (Databricks, Azure, AWS o GCP).
Dominio de técnicas de modelado de datos (relacional, dimensional, etc.).
Valoraremos positivamente si además tienes experiencia diseñando soluciones en la nube (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud). Conocimiento en herramientas Agile y gestión de proyectos (JIRA, Confluence, etc.); experiencia previa con Kafka y certificaciones en tecnologías de Big Data o Cloud Computing.




¿Qué ofrecemos?




Contrato indefinido y estabilidad en una compañía en crecimiento.
Plan de carrera individualizado para potenciar tu desarrollo profesional.
Modelo remoto de trabajo, o híbrido
Teletrabajo en periodos especiales: Navidades, Semana Santa, julio y agosto.
Horario flexible y medidas de conciliación.
Plan de formación continua, para que sigas evolucionando.
Beneficios corporativos: Retribución flexible, seguro médico, actividades de equipo y eventos internos.
Un entorno que impulsa la innovación y el crecimiento personal, fomentando la autonomía y el equilibrio entre la vida personal y profesional.
Participación en iniciativas sociales y solidarias enfocadas en educación, juventud y conocimiento.




Si te apasionan los desafíos tecnológicos y quieres ser parte de una empresa donde realmente puedas hacer la diferencia, no dudes en inscribirte




¡Queremos conocerte!

Title: Machine Learning NLP
Description:
Hay dos palabras que nos definen: talento y tecnología, porque en Scalian no entendemos una sin la otra. Nosotros ofrecemos soluciones sencillas e innovadoras a problemas complejos, que tienen un impacto positivo y sostenible en las organizaciones y en la sociedad. Pero para conseguirlo, necesitamos del talento, por eso, buscamos un/a Senior Backend Developer con experiencia en Java y Microservicios.




¿Qué buscamos?

Buscamos un/a Machine Learning NLP para integrarse en nuestro equipo de profesionales dentro del sector bancario.




Requisitos mínimos:

Conocimientos en IA generativa como en Modelos de detección.
Experiencia en Machine Learning, programación en Python y APIs.
Capacidad para realizar conexión de modelos con bases de datos para la correcta ingesta de datos y volcado de resultados. Las bases de datos están en AWS Glue, y el volcado se hace en Elasticsearch y Splunk.
Conocimientos de Código en Shell de Linux para la ejecución automática a través del crontab.
Monitorización a través de dashboards en Kibana de Elasticsearch.




¿Qué tendrás con nosotros?

Formar parte de un equipo de alto nivel bajo tecnologías punteras en el mercado.

💻 100% Teletrabajo

⛱ 25 días laborables de vacaciones

📝 Contrato indefinido

📚 Formación continua, certificaciones, meetups y planes de desarrollo profesional personalizados para que podamos seguir creciendo juntos. Contamos con acceso a plataformas internas con contenido abierto para que lo disfrutes cuando tú quieras y a tu ritmo.

🕐 Jornada completa con horario flexible para facilitar la conciliación entre vida familiar y profesional.

🎉 After works en las oficinas

🎂 La tarde del cumpleaños libre

🏋️‍♀️ Descuentos en gimnasios

💲Programas de retribución flexible: seguro médico, tarjeta restaurante, abono de transporte, cheques para escuelas infantiles.

🌏 Como parte del grupo Scalian, abrimos nuestras fronteras y crecemos internacionalmente.

♻️ En el grupo apostamos por iniciativas sostenibles.




¡Despega en tu carrera con Scalian Spain!✈
