HTML:
Fecha: 15 mar 2025

Ubicación

MADRID, M, ES, 28049

Empresa: GRUPO AUDIOVISUAL MEDIASET ESPAÑA C.

Actualmente buscamos incorporar un Data Scientist para formar parte de nuestro equipo. La persona que se incorpore se integrará dentro del equipo de Desarrollo del dato, donde participará en el desarrollo de proyectos de data para las diferentes empresas del grupo Mediaset España.

Entre Sus Principales Funciones, Destacan

  • El análisis de datos y creación de insights/KPIs.
  • La implementación de trabajos de tratamiento de datos.
  • El desarrollo de proyectos de modelización avanzada, entre otros.

Requisitos

Formación académica/complementaria

  • Grado en Matemáticas, Estadística, Ingeniería Matemática, Ingeniería de Datos o grados afines.

Idiomas

Nivel de inglés C1

Experiencia profesional

  • Al menos cuatro años de experiencia en el desarrollo de proyectos con tratamiento de datos.
  • Imprescindible contar con experiencia o conocimientos avanzados de SQL y Python.
  • Deseable experiencia en modelización, entornos cloud y metodologías MLOPS/DEVOPS.
  • Deseable experiencia o conocimientos en Sagemaker, Snowflake, SAS, AWS S3, Athena, AWS Lambda.

¿Qué ofrecemos?

  • Buen ambiente laboral donde te sentirás parte del equipo desde el primer día.
  • Condiciones salariales adaptadas a tu perfil.
  • Otros beneficios de compañía tales como: entorno de trabajo híbrido, seguro médico, comedor de empresa, retribución flexible, becas de estudio, medidas de conciliación, y mucho más.

Mediaset España mantiene su compromiso y responsabilidad con la igualdad de oportunidades y su lucha contra la discriminación en cualquier de sus formas. Por ello, se valorarán en el proceso a todos los solicitantes que cumplan con los requisitos solicitados independientemente de su condición.

Title: IA / ML Engineer 100% Remoto
Description:
La comunidad Data de knowmad mood busca incorporar un/a IA / ML Engineer para colaborar dentro de nuestro equipo.




¿Qué ofrecemos?

Horario flexible ⏰: Adapta tu jornada a tu ritmo personal, coordinando con tu equipo para disfrutar de un balance ideal entre trabajo y vida personal.
Vacaciones 🌴: Disfruta de 22 días de vacaciones más 2 días de libre disposición, además de los días 24 y 31 de diciembre libres.
Contrato indefinido 📄: Desde el primer día, con la opción de elegir si prefieres recibir tu nómina en 12 o 14 pagas.
Retribución flexible 💳: Elige cómo destinar parte de tu salario a productos o servicios con ventajas fiscales, como tarjeta restaurante, cheque guardería, seguro médico o formación.
Club de ventajas: Accede a descuentos exclusivos en tecnología, ocio y formación para mejorar tu vida personal.
Formación continua 📚: Accede a plataformas como Udemy Business, además de cursos de idiomas, certificaciones oficiales y formación técnica, adaptados a tus necesidades y ritmo.
Plan de carrera 🌱: Diseña tu propio camino de crecimiento, con apoyo para avanzar dentro de la empresa, transitar entre comunidades o asumir roles de liderazgo.
Bienestar integral 🧘: Acceso a nuestro programa de bienestar que incluye nutrición saludable, actividad física y talleres de equilibrio emocional.
Conciliación +VIDA: Asistencia personal y familiar 24/7, con servicios como consultas médicas, legales, dentales, asistencia personal, renovación de carnet de conducir y más para ti y tus familiares.
Ambiente de trabajo inclusivo 🌍: Fomentamos la diversidad generacional y cultural, con políticas activas de igualdad y diversidad en un entorno de más de 70 nacionalidades.
Eventos sociales y diversión 🎉: Participa en actividades como videojuegos multijugador, escape rooms virtuales y más, para conectar con tus compañeros fuera del entorno laboral.




¿Cuáles son los requisitos?

Amplia experiencia en ingeniería del software.
Experiencia en puesta en producción de sistemas software.
Conocimiento avanzado de herramientas para la automatización de flujos de integración continua.
Experiencia en el desarrollo de servicios web.
Conocimientos avanzados de desarrollo en Python
Amplia experiencia en Google Cloud Platform, valorable otros proveedores cloud (AWS, Azure).
Amplia experiencia en DevOps, integración y entrega continua (CI/CD): Jenkins, Cloud Build (Google).
Experiencia en diseño e implementación de procesos de despliegue de servicios web.
Experiencia en otras soluciones de gestión de infraestructura Cloud: Terraform o Ansible.
Valorable conocimiento de técnicas de analítica avanzada, Big Data e inteligencia artificial.
Valorable experiencia en el desarrollo de pipelines de datos.
Valorable conocimiento de herramientas de automatización de procesos mediante RPA.
Valorable conocimiento del sector de seguros.







¿Cuál será tu misión en el proyecto?

Coordinar la implantación de los modelos analíticos en los entornos productivos y de pruebas de la compañía.
Coordinar el análisis y preprocesamiento de datos, para alimentar los modelos de IA.
Optimizar el rendimiento de los modelos analíticos.
Monitorizar tanto los modelos analíticos como la infraestructura utilizada por los ismos.
Coordinar, desarrollar y/o mantener las actividades de industrialización asociadas a los modelos analíticos.
Coordinar y/o realizar la integración de los modelos analíticos en la arquitectura corporativa definida.
Garantizar la gestión de la calidad de los modelos analíticos puestos en producción.
Evaluar plataformas analíticas desde la perspectiva de infraestructura e integración.
Gestionar la plataforma de automatización basada en robots (RPA) corporativa
Mantener contacto frecuente con otros perfiles existentes en la Compañía como los científicos de datos, arquitectos o administradores de sistemas para la realización de las actividades anteriormente descritas.




¿Dónde trabajaras?




Desde donde tu elijas (dentro de España) , modelo 100% remoto.




¡Apúntate y te daremos más detalles! 👇

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Who we are

At CoverWallet we are determined to revolutionize the insurance industry! We launched in 2015 and since then we are the leading digital platform for contracting insurance for small and medium-sized companies. Thanks to state-of-the-art technology and meticulous design we have turned insurance management and processing into a simple, fast and convenient process for our clients. All online, in minutes!




Our passion is in delivering innovation and value creation through technology, and our mission is to become the world’s leading InsurTech. For this, we have built an incredible team of ~800 people based in New York, Spain, Poland and Singapore. Success is guaranteed as we are part of Aon, the global leaders in risk, retirement and health solutions with 50,000 colleagues worldwide. We combine the mindset and culture of a high-growth startup with the backing and support of a global multinational. The best of both worlds in one company - what more could we ask for?




What you will do

We are looking for a highly motivated and skilled Data Scientist to join our dynamic Data Science team. Our mission is to drive innovation and leverage machine learning and data-driven solutions to solve strategic business challenges. You will work across various domains, including product, sales, marketing, and operations, impacting business outcomes at scale. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced environment, enjoys solving complex problems, and is passionate about learning and leveraging data science to create real-world impact.




A typical day

Develop predictive models, advanced analytics solutions, and visualization tools for internal teams and end customers. Initial projects may include: scoring models for sales and customer service, recommendation systems, automation of repetitive tasks to improve efficiency.
Conduct complex analyses for business stakeholders, translating insights into actionable recommendations.
Own the feedback loop for testing and improving machine learning models.
Design, propose, and measure A/B tests for product features, ensuring alignment with business goals.
Identify data-driven opportunities to enhance different stages of the customer journey.
Collaborate with data engineering and infrastructure teams to develop scalable, end-to-end solutions.
Serve as a technical representative when engaging with external stakeholders.
Recommend and implement new technologies, processes, and systems to optimize efficiencies and business performance.
Maintain awareness of emerging trends in data science, machine learning, and technology.
Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code.
Produce detailed technical documentation and presentations for both technical and non-technical audiences.




What you need to succeed

BSc/BA in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Physics, Engineering, or a related field.
Around 4 - 5 years of experience as a Data Scientist
Strong communication skills to translate technical analysis into business insights.
Extensive experience with Python and data visualization frameworks (e.g., Plotly, Seaborn, Matplotlib).
Proficiency in SQL for data extraction and manipulation.
Experience with data modeling and statistical analysis.
Familiarity with cloud environments (Google Cloud, AWS, etc.).
Experience with cloud infrastructure and deployment processes.
Solid understanding of clean code principles and version control (Git).
Knowledge of Docker and containerization technologies.
Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team environment.
Nice to have: Experience in designing and measuring A/B tests.
Nice to have: Knowledge of Large Language Models (LLMs) and their applications.
Nice to have: Knowledge of best practices around service-oriented architectures or microservices.




About the recruitment process

Your first contact with CoverWallet will be through an HR interview with one of our colleagues from the Talent Acquisition area, who will tell you everything about our company and its history, as well as the details of the position, functions and your future conditions. We would love to know your professional and academic career, and of course, your motivations and expectations for a new professional project. We will be happy to answer all your questions!
Do we have a match? Let’s move on to your First Technical Interview! You will meet two of the colleagues from the Data Science team, who will explain to you in more detail what the team's day-to-day life is and its responsibilities. They will be very interested in expanding information about your experience as a Data Scientist as well as your knowledge of our main technological environments.
If everything has gone well and you have impressed our colleagues... we advance to the second stage of the process! We will send you a data challenge based on a case study to find out your technical level and you will have a maximum of 7 days to complete it.
If you've made it this far, things are getting interesting... It's time for your Final Interview! In this case, you will have the opportunity to meet one of our Heads of Data and Engineering, who will close the selection process with an interview aimed at getting to know you not only on a professional and technical level, but also on a personal level, so that both of you can reach the conclusion of whether the purpose of our project fits with your professional aspirations.




Why CoverWallet

At CoverWallet you will have the opportunity to be a key player in the transformation of one of the largest industries and in one of the most developed digital markets in the world. You will work in a cutting-edge tech environment, alongside a super powerful and diverse global team. Join us and build your own career plan in one of the world's leading companies, tailored to your dreams and aspirations! And just for good measure…




💰 Competitive salary based on your background and experience, and a variable annual bonus set according to your goals
⏰ Enjoy flexible working hours and find out your ideal way of working thanks to our smart work model: full remote or hybrid, it’s up to you!
🎁 Perks package consisting of a Company-paid Life, Accident Insurance and Medical Cover with free dental care. Complement your benefits with our flexible compensation plan (tickets restaurant, transport card, daycare checks, external training and even a Pension Scheme!)
📚 Carry on with your training thanks to your additional budget of 1,500€ per year to finance training courses, certifications, books or any teaching aids that will help you continue to grow professionally
🛒 Enjoy a lot of offers and save on your purchases thanks to our discount platform (BigPocket) on your favorite brands (travel, fashion, technology, leisure...)
🏝 23 paid vacation days per year, plus 2 additional personal days and 2 wellbeing days to focus on your own health and prioritize self-care :)
🍏 Great offices in Madrid, Valencia and Sevilla. Come and enjoy all the activities we do, both inside and outside the office (hackathons, meetups, tech talks, code katas and much more!)

Title: ML Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
About the Job


We’re hiring ML Engineer to join our awesome and growing team. In this role, you will have the privilege of working on innovative projects in machine learning, utilising your expertise to develop impactful solutions. From conceptualisation to execution, you will play a pivotal role in leading and contributing to comprehensive projects.





Collect raw data from various sources such as databases, APIs, and data streams, ensuring accuracy and consistency through thorough cleaning.


Design/Develop/Integrate practical machine learning (ML) solutions across different industries and use cases to create robust ML systems.


Conduct machine learning tests and experiments.


Work closely with cross-functional teams (engineers, managers) to understand business requirements and develop data-driven solutions.


Stay updated with the latest developments in data science and machine learning.


Participate in agile SCRUM teams for tool and prototype development.





About the job:





A degree in computer science, statistics, mathematics, or a related field is required. A master’s degree in data science is a plus.


Professional working experience in the field.


Knowledge of machine learning algorithms and techniques.


Working experience with LLMs and related techniques.


Strong analytical and problem-solving skills and attention to detail.


Excellent communication in English and interpersonal skills.


Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team.


Software skills are highly desirable.





Benefits:





Competitive salary


Flexible work schedule and remote work options


+2 days extra off (Christmas and NYE)


Travel budget to explore Munich and/or Barcelona


Company-sponsored social events, (e.g., team-retreats in Mallorca, Italy) and team-building activities (e.g., yearly Christmas hackathon)


Opportunities for growth and advancement within MVST (e.g., €1.500 on top, sponsored Udemy courses)


Free language courses


Home office budget


Sponsored gym membership


Digital vouchers for meals and (public) transport tickets


Monthly company breakfast and lunch


Free coffee, water, fresh fruits and snacks, granola bar for breakfasts

Title: Data Scientist Junior- EY wavespace Data & AI hub
Description:
EY wavespace is creating innovative AI technology and products that will transform EY and our clients. The successful candidate will be part of a team building innovative AI solutions that rely on AI and ML techniques including but not limited to natural language processing, computer vision, deep learning, and machine learning. Our Generative AI center of excellence is expanding and we are looking for a passionate data scientist to be part of the growing team!




You will work with:




Explore and try out exciting upcoming libraries, models, technologies to analyze and recommend the best one for the team
Design and implement scalable ML and DL systems, products, and solutions.
Collaborate with engineering and DevOps teams to build and deliver systems that can be deployed both in the cloud and on premise, e.g., using Azure, Docker, and Kubernetes.
Build deep learning-based products on CPUs and GPUs, leveraging latest deep learning and machine learning libraries.
Develop and evaluate data analytics models, algorithms, systems and solutions using a variety of advanced data science techniques
Produces complex predictive models and manages the delivery of solutions which can be used to drive measurable client and commercial benefit
Develops a solid understanding of data structures and business in order to extract and integrate required data sources for analysis




Key requirements

Excellent programming skills: Experience in languages such as Python
1-2 years of relevant experience
You have experience with both machine learning and building software
You have experience with databases
Machine learning domain knowledge—bias-variance tradeoff, exploration/exploitation—and understanding of various model families, including neural net, decision trees, Bayesian models, instance-based learning, association learning, and deep learning algorithms
Good understanding in Deep Learning, NLP, LLM
Familiarity with Azure cloud ecosystem and OpenAI models
Experience working with large data sets
Excellent problem-solving skills
Strong communication and teamwork
Familiarity with Financial Services
Proficiency in English




If you feel that you meet these requirements, please apply with your ENGLISH CV. Due to extremely high level of applications, incomplete files or applications without CV in English will NOT be taken forward.




Our commitment to diversity & inclusion

We are genuinely passionate about inclusion and we support individuals of all groups; we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, or disability status.

  • Collaborate with engineering and DevOps teams to build and deliver systems that can be deployed both in the cloud and on premise, e.g., using Azure, Docker, and Kubernetes.
  • Build deep learning-based products on CPUs and GPUs, leveraging latest deep learning and machine learning libraries.
  • Develop and evaluate data analytics models, algorithms, systems and solutions using a variety of advanced data science techniques
  • Produces complex predictive models and manages the delivery of solutions which can be used to drive measurable client and commercial benefit
  • Develops a solid understanding of data structures and business in order to extract and integrate required data sources for analysis


Key requirements

  • Excellent programming skills: Experience in languages such as Python
  • 1-2 years of relevant experience
  • You have experience with both machine learning and building software
  • You have experience with databases
  • Machine learning domain knowledge—bias-variance tradeoff, exploration/exploitation—and understanding of various model families, including neural net, decision trees, Bayesian models, instance-based learning, association learning, and deep learning algorithms
  • Good understanding in Deep Learning, NLP, LLM
  • Familiarity with Azure cloud ecosystem and OpenAI models
  • Experience working with large data sets
  • Excellent problem-solving skills
  • Strong communication and teamwork
  • Familiarity with Financial Services
  • Proficiency in English


If you feel that you meet these requirements, please apply with your ENGLISH CV. Due to extremely high level of applications, incomplete files or applications without CV in English will NOT be taken forward.


Our commitment to diversity & inclusion

We are genuinely passionate about inclusion and we support individuals of all groups; we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, or disability status.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Internship
Description:
Somos Applus+ Laboratories, la división del Grupo Applus+ que proporciona servicios de ensayo, certificación e ingeniería de desarrollo de producto. El equipo de Operaciones da soporte de manera transversal a toda la división, tanto a nivel nacional como internacional. Actualmente estamos creciendo y buscamos un/a estudiante en prácticas para incorporarse a nuestro equipo.




El equipo de Digital Business de Applus+ desarrolla soluciones digitales innovadoras para optimizar productos y procesos a nivel global. Su objetivo es organizar y estructurar la información de Applus+ Laboratories, haciéndola más útil, rápida y confiable tanto para el Grupo Applus+ como para sus clientes.




Buscamos un estudiante en prácticas para integrarse en nuestro equipo digital y participar en el desarrollo de productos y aplicaciones de datos en evolución. Durante la estancia, el estudiante adquirirá experiencia en ciencia de datos, inteligencia artificial y desarrollo de modelos, con la guía de profesionales del sector.




El estudiante seleccionado se formará en las siguientes tareas:

Recopilar, organizar y analizar información para generar código, entrenar modelos y validar resultados.
Aplicar métodos numéricos y estadísticos, así como algoritmos de aprendizaje automático.
Desarrollar conocimientos en procesamiento del lenguaje natural (NLP) y modelos fundacionales, comprendiendo el funcionamiento de transformadores, tokenización y procesos de codificación-decodificación.
Utilizar técnicas de Explainable AI y trabajar con librerías de Python como SHAP o LIME.
Aprender a documentar correctamente el trabajo y escribir código limpio y bien comentado.
Desarrollar habilidades de pensamiento analítico, lógica y resolución de problemas con un enfoque innovador.




Eres el candidato ideal si

Que actualmente estés estudiando un Grado en Ingeniería, Data Science, Máster en Inteligencia Artificial o similar, con la posibilidad de realizar un convenio en prácticas
Que tengas ganas de aprender e interés por trabajar en un entorno multinacional
Que seas dinámico/a y proactivo/a
Que tengas un nivel fluido de inglés

Show more

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Hi! 👋🏼

At Shakers, we're on the lookout for an AI Engineer to take our Product team to the next level 🚀

1. Team and Role

If you have experience in developing AI systems, thrive in dynamic startup environments, and are ready to take your career to the next level, we want to hear from you.

This role offers the opportunity to gain full experience within a rapidly growing startup. We are a small, highly committed team with strong connections to other teams, so you'll have the chance to learn and grow quickly. There's a lot to be done! If you're excited about working in an innovative and fast-paced environment, collaborating with a talented team, and making a direct impact, this is your opportunity! 🤩



2. What you´ll be doing

Your day-to-day as an AI Engineer

As an AI Engineer, you will work hand in hand with one of our aquads to contribute to the key areas of the AI team, primarily:

Development of conversational systems: You will design, implement, and optimize AI products, chatbots, and virtual assistants that enhance the experience of our users.
Integration of third-party AI APIs: You will work with APIs such as OpenAI, Anthropic, Gemini AI, etc., integrating them effectively into our solutions.
Implementation of RAG systems (Retrieval Augmented Generation): You will create systems that combine knowledge bases with generative models for precise and contextualized responses.
Development with specialized libraries: You will use LangChain, LlamaIndex, LangFlow, and our own framework to build robust and scalable AI solutions.
Model evaluation and testing: You will implement evaluation methodologies to continuously measure and improve the performance of our models.
Cost and performance optimization: You will work on continuously improving our AI systems, balancing quality, speed, and operational costs.
Cross-disciplinary collaboration: You will work with product, engineering, and business teams to align AI solutions with strategic objectives.
Applied research: You will stay up-to-date with the latest advances in AI and evaluate new technologies for potential implementation.




3. What we´re looking for

We need someone who...

Has 2-4 years of experience programming AI solutions in Python, especially in startup or tech company environments.
Has experience with conversational systems and chatbots using large language models (LLMs).
Has worked with third-party AI APIs (OpenAI, Anthropic, Hugging Face, etc.).
Has experience in prompt engineering, dynamic prompt declaration, CoT, and self-evaluation methods.

It’s very important that you...

Are familiar with and have implemented RAG (Retrieval Augmented Generation) systems.
Have experience with libraries like LangChain, LlamaIndex, or LangFlow.
Follow best development practices: version control, documentation, unit testing, etc.
Are up-to-date with the latest trends and advancements in generative AI.

You’re perfect for us if you also have experience in...

Knowledge of Docker, CI/CD, deployment, and DevOps.
Knowledge of ML, predictive AI, recommendation systems.
Experience working with cloud providers such as AWS Bedrock, Microsoft Azure, or Gemini Vertex.
Experience building APIs with frameworks like FastAPI or similar.
Experience implementing testing and evaluation methodologies for AI models.




4. What's in it for you?

Compensation 💰

The salary range for this position is between 26.000€ and 46.000€ OTE (on target earnings) gross annual salary.

The salary consists of:

Between 26.000€ & 40.000€ fixed salary.
Up to 15% (6.000€) quarterly bonus based on performance & potential.

Why you´ll love working at Shakers 💚

Be part of a rapidly growing, internationally expanding startup. 🌍
Have an ambitious professional development plan to help you reach your full potential.
Enjoy an unbeatable team culture—ask anyone on our team!
Take advantage of our hybrid ful flex methodology: a mix of remote and in-office work, with our office located in the heart of Madrid, Calle Velázquez.
Perks include wellness programs, gym access, English classes, medical insurance, and more.

At the office... 📍

Organic fruit
Free caffeine and theine

5. Our recruitment process

As a startup, we are very agile and we like to see results quickly, which is why prioritize efficiency in our recruitment process.

Our goal is to have you onboard this May, so you can hit the ground running and make an impact from day one!


The Road to Joining Our Team


Round 1, Cultural Fit: Kick things off with an informal chat with our People & Culture team. Don’t worry—we just want to get to know you better, learn about your goals, hobbies, and more!
Round 2, Case Study & Technical Skills with Product Team: Join two members of our Product team for a deep dive into a case study. This is your chance to showcase your client management skills and demonstrate how you approach problem-solving.
Round 3, Meet the Team: Have a conversation with additional team members to further explore your skillset and ensure there's a great cultural fit. This is also your chance to ask questions and see how we collaborate.
Final check, CEO Chat: Meet Héctor, our CEO! He’s excited to connect with you, talk about Shakers’ future, and discuss your vision and expectations.
More about Shakers

At Shakers we imagine, design, and create the next-generation way of working.

Our vision is to be the leading community and platform in the world that helps companies work with freelance teams through our technology.

We are a 45-person, fast growing startup based in Madrid. It's the place for you if you're looking for a high-performance, very dynamic & technological environment surrounded by ambitious people!



Our DNA

At Shakers, we are obsessed with our values. Half of our bonuses are performance-based, and the other half come from embodying what it means to be a true Shaker!

WINNING TEAM 🏆

We all feel like part of a winning team—one that pushes boundaries, challenges the status quo, and moves the needle! We set ambitious goals and seek people who are driven to achieve them.

F1C10 💪🏼

We’re building an environment where fear doesn’t hold us back. Experimentation and learning from failure are part of our DNA. Fail fast, grow faster. Fail 1X, chase 10X. We value risk-takers who aren’t afraid to go big!

STAY HUMBLE 🤲🏼

We embrace a beginner’s mindset—always evolving, always learning, and always finding new solutions. At Shakers, humility combined with ambition fuels our success, and when we blend the two, the results are extraordinary!




A huge thanks for being interested in Shakers, we'd love to see you soon.

Title: Data Scientist - Claims
Description:
Analista de Datos en la oficina de Reporting, Fraude y Proveedores dentro de la dirección de Siniestros.

La persona seleccionada garantizá la adecuada evaluación de la información interna y externa para optimizar los procesos de tramitación y proporcionar información valiosa para la toma de decisiones

Responsabilidades


Analizar datos de siniestros para identificar patrones y tendencias.
Colaborar con los equipos de tramitación de siniestros para la optimización de los procesos.
Elaboración y actualización de informes y cuadros de mando que sirvan como apoyo en la toma de decisiones (tramitación, proveedores, fraude, etc.).
Utilizar técnicas de análisis estadístico y herramientas de visualización de datos.
Desarrollar modelos predictivos que anticipen el comportamiento de los siniestros y optimicen la operativa.
Participar en la implementación de cambios que incrementen la eficiencia y reduzcan costes.
Colaboración en proyectos transversales como la elaboración del Plan anual o grupos de trabajo.
Comunicación efectiva con otros departamentos de la entidad (financiero, organización, suscripción, etc.) para la consecución de logros comunes.
Elaboración. desarrollo y mantenimiento de los diversos controles internos que permitan la mitigación de riesgos.
Extracción y documentación de informes para los stakeholders de la Joint Venture.
Aplicación de las políticas y estándares del Grupo Allianz.


Requisitos


Título universitario en Estadística, Matemáticas o Actuariales.
Experiencia previa en análisis de datos (3-5 años), en entidades aseguradoras.
Dominio de herramientas de análisis de datos como SQL, SAS, Python, y software de visualización Power BI
Habilidades analíticas y capacidad para resolver problemas complejos.
Excelentes habilidades de comunicación y alta capacidad para trabajar en equipo.
Capacidades de iniciativa para proponer y liderar mejoras en procesos y análisis


¿Qué ofrecemos?


Contrato Indefinido
Oficinas que se adaptan a tus necesidades, con modelo smartworking y espacios colaborativos;
Horarios flexibles para que tengas una buena conciliación entre tu vida personal y laboral;
Formación específica en tu ámbito de actuación y programa You Learn We Pay;
Múltiples descuentos de empleado/a
Compensación económica para los gastos de comida y teletrabajo;
Precios especiales en la contratación de productos de seguros para ti y los tuyos;
Muchos beneficios más..
¿Sabías que tenemos beneficios adicionales para empleados con discapacidad y/o que tengan algún familiar directo con alguna discapacidad? Sólo debes mostrar tu certificado y ya podrás acceder a los mismos (por sólo mostrar tu certificado tendrás una bonificación en tu primera nómina de 1.500€)


[please translate into your local language]

69224 | Data & Analytics | Profesional / Senior | Non-Executive | Allianz Spain | Jornada completa | Indefinido

El Grupo Allianz es una de las compañías asesguradoras y de gestión de activos de mayor confianza en el mundo. Cuidar a nuestros empleados, sus ambiciones, sueños y desafíos, es lo que nos convierte en un empleador único. Juntos podemos construir un entorno en el que todos se sientan empoderados y con la confianza para explorar, crecer y dar forma a un futuro mejor para nuestros clientes y el mundo que nos rodea.

En Allianz creemos en una plantilla diversa e inclusiva y estamos orgullosos de ser un empleador que ofrece igualdad de oportunidades. Te animamos a dar lo mejor de ti en el trabajo, sin importar de dónde eres, tu aspecto, a quién amas o en qué crees.

Por lo tanto, consideramos solicitudes de empleo independientemente de su origen étnico o cultural, edad, género, nacionalidad, religión, capacidad diferente u orientación sexual.

Es genial tenerte a bordo. Let´s care for tomorrow.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist - Global Consulting Partner - Madrid




Tech stack: Data Scientist Python/R/Java/C++, Cloud Azure AWS, Git/GitHub/GitLab/Bitbucket, SQL, Cloud, Docker, Kubernetes, Data Scientist




Our client, one of the most known consultancy companies in the world is looking to expand their Data & Analytics team, bringing some professionals that want to work with the best clients in th emarket.




Our client is looking for talented, enthusiastic and passionate Data Scientists (Data Scientist Python/R/Java/C++, Cloud Azure AWS, Git/GitHub/GitLab/Bitbucket, SQL, Cloud, Docker, Kubernetes, Data Scientist) to bring their services to the market and help enhance this already successful company!




Successful Data Scientists candidates should be able to demonstrate strong knowledge of: Python/R/Java/C++, Cloud Azure AWS, Git/GitHub/GitLab/Bitbucket, SQL, Cloud, Docker, Kubernetes




Training will be provided in any of the technologies you lack, allowing you to turn your technological weaknesses into your greatest strengths!




All Data Scientists positions come with the following benefits:




25 days holiday (plus Public Holidays)
REAL flexibility on how and when you work
Allowance for trainings/certifications/conferences
Insurance
Private medical




Location: Madrid, Spain / Hybrid Working




Salary: 49k for Seniors and above 50k for managers (with 20% bonus)




InterEx Group are Experts in Data, ERP and CRM, we are committed to supporting your career progression!

Title: DATA SCIENTIST INTERN
Description:
En Mango vestimos de pasión todo lo que hacemos. Con origen en Barcelona y presencia en más de 120 países, inspiramos al mundo con creatividad, innovación y autenticidad.

Nuestro equipo multicultural es el motor de nuestro éxito. nos enorgullece llevar la moda más allá, conectando nuestro estilo único con personas de todo el mundo.

Como Data Scientist, formarás parte del equipo que da forma a la inteligencia, estrategia y arquitectura de datos de Mango. El equipo de Advanced Analytics desarrolla algoritmos de Inteligencia Artificial dirigidos a optimizar los procesos y decisiones más desafiantes dentro de la industria del retail.

Desarrollarás soluciones punteras de ciencia de datos y aprendizaje automático para habilitar casos de uso muy innovadores en el sector retail, como geoanalítica, robotización, personalización omnicanal, la tienda omnicanal, consumidor 360º y decisiones en tiempo real.

¿QUÉ HACE UN DATA SCIENTIST EN MANGO?


Realizarás el desarrollo de algoritmos avanzados de aprendizaje automático para mejorar nuestros procesos y decisiones comerciales principales.
Trabajarás con un sólido enfoque de ingeniería (por ejemplo, integración continua, automatización de pruebas, etc.) en un sólido equipo de ingenieros de datos y científicos de datos.
Utilizarás Spark para escalar tus modelos y aprovecha las herramientas de MLOps para desplegarlos en producción.
Trabajarás con AWS services como S3, Lambda, DynamoDB, EC2, etc.
Trabajarás con un sólido enfoque de ingeniería en un equipo formado por Data Scientist, Data Engineers, Data Architects y desarrolladores full stack.



¿QUÉ ESPERAMOS DE TI?


Que estés estudiando un Ingeniería Informática, Matemáticas o Estadística o Ciencia de Datos con buenos resultados académicos.
Que tengas conocimiento sobre Data Modelling y SQL.
Tengas capacidad para programar (o facilidad de aprendizaje) en Python, R o Scala.



¿QUÉ NOS HACE ESPECIALES?


Formarás parte de una empresa internacional en plena transformación tecnológica, como parte del equipo de Data & Advanced Analytics de Mango.
6 meses de prácticas (remuneradas).
Transporte gratuito de empresa desde Barcelona y el Vallès para llegar a nuestras oficinas centrales.
Posibilidad de teletrabajo en un 50%.



Taking Fashion

Title: Research Engineer – Machine Learning (Re1)
Description:
Reference: 88_25_ES_CES_RE1

Job title: Research engineer – Machine Learning (RE1)

About BSC

The Barcelona Supercomputing Center – Centro Nacional de Supercomputación (BSC-CNS) is the leading supercomputing center in Spain.

It houses MareNostrum, one of the most powerful supercomputers in Europe, was a founding and hosting member of the former European HPC infrastructure PRACE (Partnership for Advanced Computing in Europe), and is now hosting entity for EuroHPC JU, the Joint Undertaking that leads large-scale investments and HPC provision in Europe.

The mission of BSC is to research, develop and manage information technologies in order to facilitate scientific progress.

BSC combines HPC service provision and R&D into both computer and computational science (life, earth and engineering sciences) under one roof, and currently has over 1000 staff from 60 countries.

We are particularly interested for this role in the strengths and lived experiences of women and underrepresented groups to help us avoid perpetuating biases and oversights in science and IT research.

In instances of equal merit, the incorporation of the under-represented sex will be favoured.

We promote Equity, Diversity and Inclusion, fostering an environment where each and every one of us is appreciated for who we are, regardless of our differences.

Context And Mission

We are seeking a highly motivated Research Engineer with expertise in machine learning, data science, or computational environmental sciences to contribute to cutting-edge research in Earth Sciences.

The selected candidate will play a key role in developing and optimizing machine learning workflows for large-scale land-use, land-cover, and Leaf Area Index (LAI) reconstruction, supporting both historical and future climate scenarios.

This position involves integrating deep learning models, refining data workflows, and contributing to predictive modeling efforts within multiple European projects, including TerraDT and CONCERTO.

It builds upon methodologies established in the CERISE project and aims to generate high-resolution, temporally extended datasets to improve climate model simulations and advanced Earth system modeling capabilities.

This role provides a unique opportunity to work with an interdisciplinary team of machine learning researchers and climate scientists.

The team will focus on developing scalable solutions for processing and analyzing high-dimensional environmental data.

The selected candidate will also contribute to scientific publications, project documentation, and technical reporting, collaborating on research efforts within international projects.

Key Duties Develop and optimize large-scale machine learning workflows for Earth Science applications, focusing on land-use, land-cover, and LAI downscaling for both historical and future scenarios.Implement and evaluate deep learning architectures for predictive modeling of land-use, land-cover, and climate-related variables, while developing model evaluation methodologies, including visualization and validation tools to compare deep learning models with traditional baselines.Refactor and modularize existing machine learning pipelines to improve scalability, efficiency, and deep learning integration.Work with large geospatial datasets (NetCDF, Zarr) and optimize data processing workflows for high-performance computing (HPC) environments.Ensure that reconstructed land-use, land-cover, and LAI datasets align with Earth system modeling requirements.Participate in scientific publications and technical reporting, contributing to documentation, with opportunities to be involved in academic publications and project reporting.Requirements Education: Bachelor or Master's in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Data Science, Environmental Sciences, or a related field.

Essential Knowledge and Professional Experience: Strong programming skills in Python, with experience in machine learning libraries such as PyTorch and Scikit-learn.Proven experience in developing and training machine learning models, particularly deep learning architectures.Strong background in handling, analyzing, and validating large-scale geospatial datasets.Experience working in a UNIX-based computational environment.Additional Knowledge and Professional Experience: Familiarity with climate, weather, and Earth system datasets (NetCDF, Zarr).Experience in high-performance computing (HPC) and parallelized machine learning workflows.Proficiency in GPU-accelerated machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, RAPIDS, JAX and/or distributed training using Dask.Understanding of climate and weather models.Competences: Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to optimize computational workflows.Ability to work independently while collaborating effectively in a research environment.Excellent communication skills, with a strong ability to document and present research findings.Proficiency in written and spoken English.Conditions The position will be located at BSC within the Earth Sciences Department.

We offer a full-time contract (37.5h/week), a good working environment, a highly stimulating environment with state-of-the-art infrastructure, flexible working hours, extensive training plan, restaurant tickets, private health insurance, support to the relocation procedures.

Duration: Open-ended contract due to technical and scientific activities linked to the project and budget duration.

Holidays: 23 paid vacation days plus 24th and 31st of December per our collective agreement.

Salary: we offer a competitive salary commensurate with the qualifications and experience of the candidate and according to the cost of living in Barcelona.

Starting date: 01/03/2025.

Applications procedure and process All applications must be submitted via the BSC website and contain:

A full CV in English including contact details.A cover/motivation letter with a statement of interest in English, clearly specifying for which specific area and topics the applicant wishes to be considered.

Additionally, two references for further contacts must be included.

Applications without this document will not be considered.Development of the recruitment process The selection will be carried out through a competitive examination system ("Concurso-Oposición").

The Recruitment Process Consists Of Two Phases

Curriculum Analysis: Evaluation of previous experience and/or scientific history, degree, training, and other professional information relevant to the position.

– 40 points.Interview phase: The highest-rated candidates at the curriculum level will be invited to the interview phase, conducted by the corresponding department and Human Resources.

In this phase, technical competencies, knowledge, skills, and professional experience related to the position, as well as the required personal competencies, will be evaluated.

– 60 points.

A minimum of 30 points out of 60 must be obtained to be eligible for the position.The recruitment panel will be composed of at least three people, ensuring at least 25% representation of women.

In accordance with OTM-R principles, a gender-balanced recruitment panel is formed for each vacancy at the beginning of the process.

After reviewing the content of the applications, the panel will begin the interviews, with at least one technical and one administrative interview.

At a minimum, a personality questionnaire as well as a technical exercise will be conducted during the process.

The panel will make a final decision, and all individuals who participated in the interview phase will receive feedback with details on the acceptance or rejection of their profile.

At BSC, we seek continuous improvement in our recruitment processes.

For any suggestions or comments/complaints about our recruitment processes, please contact ******.

Deadline The vacancy will remain open until a suitable candidate has been hired.

Applications will be regularly reviewed and potential candidates will be contacted.

OTM-R principles for selection processes BSC-CNS is committed to the principles of the Code of Conduct for the Recruitment of Researchers of the European Commission and the Open, Transparent and Merit-based Recruitment principles (OTM-R).

This is applied for any potential candidate in all our processes, for example by creating gender-balanced recruitment panels and recognizing career breaks etc.

BSC-CNS is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion.

We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or any other basis protected by applicable state or local law.

Title: Data Scientist Junior
Description:
👀 ¿Te consideras una persona dinámica y con ganas de aprender?

🤜🤛 ¿Te gusta colaborar y trabajar en equipo?

💻 ¿Tienes pasión por la tecnología?

Si tienes ganas de poner en práctica tus conocimientos y participar en un proyecto real, no dudes en inscribirte, ¡estamos buscando a una persona como tú!




🎯Nuestra propuesta

Somos la empresa de consultoría y servicios digitales avanzados de la Universidad Politécnica de Cataluña (UPC). Creamos soluciones y servicios que ayudan a las organizaciones a ser más competitivas mejorando la vida de las personas. Combinamos el conocimiento generado en la UPC con el talento y la experiencia de nuestro equipo formado por más de 200 profesionales de la ingeniería y la consultoría, adquirida trabajando en proyectos y empresas líderes desde hace más de 20 años. Facilitamos el crecimiento de las personas de nuestro equipo para que sean las y los líderes tecnológicos del futuro. Lo hacemos en un buen ambiente de trabajo y con condiciones flexibles.

Buscamos una persona que participe en proyectos que integran analítica avanzada, arquitecturas de gestión de datos, business intelligence y/o algoritmos de inteligencia artificial con el objetivo de construir soluciones y servicios que faciliten la toma de decisiones.




🏁 Tu reto

Diseñar y desarrollar modelos y soluciones avanzadas basadas en datos para dar respuesta a necesidades de negocio, aplicando técnicas de machine learning, IA generativa y análisis predictivo.
Utilizar metodologías avanzadas de programación, matemáticas y estadística para transformar datos en conocimiento accionable y generar impacto en la toma de decisiones.
Dar soporte a la persona que gestiona el proyecto en el diseño de las soluciones que mejor respondan a las necesidades de cada proyecto a partir de los recursos y capacidades disponibles.




🔍 Necesitarás

Formación: Titulación universitaria en STEM

Experiencia:

+2 años de experiencia en una posició similar
En técnicas de Inteligencia Artificial: Machine Learning, IA Generativa, NLP, Deep Learning
Programación con Python

Conocimientos:

Ingeniería de datos

Competencias:

Capacidad de trabajo en equipo
Capacidad analítica y de resolución de problemas
Habilidades de comunicación
Capacidad de aprender de manera autónoma
Idiomas: español y catalán fluidos




🌟 Destacarás si tienes...

Experiencia previa en metodologías Agile




🫶Como IThinkUPC cuida de ti

🤝 Incorporación inmediata

🌱 Estabilidad laboral y crecimiento profesional

⚖️ Conciliación de la vida personal i profesional: disponemos de un innovador y premiado programa propio de conciliación "PEOPLE FIRST" porque nos importan las personas de nuestra compañía. Este programa incluye un conjunto de medidas en diferentes ámbitos para favorecer la conciliación:

⏳ Jornada de 37,5h semanales

🕙 Flexibilidad de horarios de entrada y salida

🗓️ Jornadas intensivas (verano, Semana Santa, Navidad y todos los viernes del año)

✈️ 28 días hábiles de vacaciones al año

✍️ Permisos adicionales de maternidad y paternidad, exámenes, etc.

🧑‍💻 Modelo híbrido de teletrabajo

🎉 y otros permisos especiales!

📚 Desarrollo profesional: disponemos de un programa de formació continua que te ayudará en tu desarrollo profesional: certificaciones oficiales, campus online propio, formaciones técnicas y en habilidades, formación en inglés, congresos, etc.

✔ Ventajas económicas en el entorno UPC: hasta un 40% de descuento en programas de máster, postgrado y cursos de formación continua en la "UPC School", descuentos en la Optica Universitaria, Deportes UPC, etc.

💰 Plan de retribució flexible de acuerdo a tus necesidades: abono de transporte, ticket restaurante, seguro médico y ticket guardería.

🧐 Puedes conocer más sobre nuestro de Analytics Consulting en el siguiente link

¿Te gustaría unirte a nosotros en esta aventura? 🚀

Title: Data Scientist (ML & IA)
Description:
SegurCaixa Adeslas es la compañía No Vida líder en España en seguros de salud, integrada en el Grupo Mutua Madrileña y participada por CaixaBank.




En los últimos años se ha convertido en una entidad de referencia gracias a la implantación de un modelo de negocio basado en el crecimiento sostenido y rentable, que sitúa al cliente en el centro de la estrategia. A través de su acuerdo de bancaseguros con CaixaBank, SegurCaixa Adeslas comercializa sus productos en la mayor red bancaria de España. Adicionalmente, la aseguradora cuenta con una red tradicional con más de 4.000 puntos de venta y atención al cliente.




Estamos convencid@s de que las personas son el principal valor de nuestra compañía y por eso SegurCaixa Adeslas se muestra absolutamente comprometida con la igualdad de oportunidades entre hombres y mujeres. Nuestro Plan de Igualdad persigue hacer efectivo este principio y por ello, el proceso de selección de nuestras ofertas garantiza la igualdad de oportunidades a todas las candidaturas.




¿Qué buscamos?




El equipo de Analítica Avanzada quiere incorporar un/a Senior Data Scientist, que nos ayude al posicionamiento del área como un elemento diferenciador dentro de la compañía, aportando soluciones de analítica avanzada que tengan impacto real en el negocio.




En tu día a día, asumirás el reto de gestionar proyectos, diseñar y construir soluciones de Analítica Avanzada, aplicando técnicas de ML, IA, etc. con impacto directo en negocio.




FUNCIONES




Diseñar, desarrollar y productivizar soluciones analíticas avanzadas basadas en datos para ayudar a la toma de decisiones, cumpliendo con los requerimientos de negocio.
Liderar el diseño, análisis y preprocesamiento de datos, junto con los/as Data Engineer, para alimentar los modelos de ML.
Creación de escenarios de simulación y análisis del impacto esperado por los diferentes modelos en los resultados.
Comunicación con Negocio constante, para identificar las necesidades de negocio y dar respuestas a los problemas de negocio usando análisis y técnicas de modelado sobre los datos.
Seguimiento, control y análisis continuo de resultados de los principales indicadores de negocio impactados por las soluciones analíticas y de las métricas técnicas asociadas, en el marco de la mejora continua.
Evaluar y seleccionar los modelos estadísticos, reglas o soluciones más adecuados para cada caso de uso.
Participar en el ciclo de productivización MLOps.




REQUISITOS




Licenciado/a o Grado en Estadística / Matemáticas / Actuariales con máster en Data Science.
Experiencia: 3-5 años experiencia trabajando como Data Scientist diseñando e implementando técnicas de ML / IA con Python.
Valorable experiencia en sector seguros




Informática y aplicaciones:




Gran dominio y experiencia en Python
Dominio de librerías de IA y ML
Conocimiento y experiencia en entorno Cloud, Azure / Databricks
Necesario: Gran conocimiento y comprensión de métodos de Machine Learning







¿Eres la persona que buscamos?

En @SegurCaixaAdeslas te estamos esperando ¡¡Únete a nosotros/as!!

Show more
HTML:
SegurCaixa Adeslas es la compañía No Vida líder en España en seguros de salud, integrada en el Grupo Mutua Madrileña y participada por CaixaBank.


En los últimos años se ha convertido en una entidad de referencia gracias a la implantación de un modelo de negocio basado en el crecimiento sostenido y rentable, que sitúa al cliente en el centro de la estrategia. A través de su acuerdo de bancaseguros con CaixaBank, SegurCaixa Adeslas comercializa sus productos en la mayor red bancaria de España. Adicionalmente, la aseguradora cuenta con una red tradicional con más de 4.000 puntos de venta y atención al cliente.


Estamos convencid@s de que las personas son el principal valor de nuestra compañía y por eso SegurCaixa Adeslas se muestra absolutamente comprometida con la igualdad de oportunidades entre hombres y mujeres. Nuestro Plan de Igualdad persigue hacer efectivo este principio y por ello, el proceso de selección de nuestras ofertas garantiza la igualdad de oportunidades a todas las candidaturas.


¿Qué buscamos?


El equipo de Analítica Avanzada quiere incorporar un/a Senior Data Scientist, que nos ayude al posicionamiento del área como un elemento diferenciador dentro de la compañía, aportando soluciones de analítica avanzada que tengan impacto real en el negocio.


En tu día a día, asumirás el reto de gestionar proyectos, diseñar y construir soluciones de Analítica Avanzada, aplicando técnicas de ML, IA, etc. con impacto directo en negocio.


FUNCIONES


  • Diseñar, desarrollar y productivizar soluciones analíticas avanzadas basadas en datos para ayudar a la toma de decisiones, cumpliendo con los requerimientos de negocio.
  • Liderar el diseño, análisis y preprocesamiento de datos, junto con los/as Data Engineer, para alimentar los modelos de ML.
  • Creación de escenarios de simulación y análisis del impacto esperado por los diferentes modelos en los resultados.
  • Comunicación con Negocio constante, para identificar las necesidades de negocio y dar respuestas a los problemas de negocio usando análisis y técnicas de modelado sobre los datos.
  • Seguimiento, control y análisis continuo de resultados de los principales indicadores de negocio impactados por las soluciones analíticas y de las métricas técnicas asociadas, en el marco de la mejora continua.
  • Evaluar y seleccionar los modelos estadísticos, reglas o soluciones más adecuados para cada caso de uso.
  • Participar en el ciclo de productivización MLOps.


REQUISITOS


  • Licenciado/a o Grado en Estadística / Matemáticas / Actuariales con máster en Data Science.
  • Experiencia: 3-5 años experiencia trabajando como Data Scientist diseñando e implementando técnicas de ML / IA con Python.
  • Valorable experiencia en sector seguros


Informática y aplicaciones:


  • Gran dominio y experiencia en Python
  • Dominio de librerías de IA y ML
  • Conocimiento y experiencia en entorno Cloud, Azure / Databricks
  • Necesario: Gran conocimiento y comprensión de métodos de Machine Learning



¿Eres la persona que buscamos?

En @SegurCaixaAdeslas te estamos esperando ¡¡Únete a nosotros/as!!

Title: Data Scientist (Trainee)
Description:
About seQura

seQura provides innovative, flexible and easy-to-use payment technologies that help merchants acquire, convert and retain more customers.

We make a difference in sales performance by tailoring our solutions to different sectors, to address their unique pain points and deliver superior results in Retail, Education (EduQa), Optics (OptiQa), Repairs and Travel.

We also empower smart shopping to consumers who seek more value, convenience, and flexibility in their shopping, with new payment experiences that allow them to save, access interest-free credit, or pay in small, comfortable installments of up to 24 months.




Born in Barcelona, seQura is a privately-owned fintech, currently expanding throughout southern Europe and Latin America, growing above 50% CAGR and approaching 100 Million in Annual Recurring Revenue. Over 5000 businesses, almost 2 million shoppers, and almost 400 employees continue to rate us as one of the most loved and trusted fintechs out there, with an NPS of 87%, a Trustpilot rating of 4.7/5, and a Glassdoor rating of 4.7/5




We are seeking a Data Scientist Trainee to join our dynamic Data Science & AI team. This is an exciting opportunity for someone eager to kickstart their career in data science and artificial intelligence. As a Data Scientist Trainee, you will have the chance to participate in a groundbreaking project alongside experienced professionals. You'll work closely with our team, gaining hands-on experience and learning the latest techniques in data analysis, machine learning, and AI development.







What challenges you'll be solving 🚀

Build and implement machine learning models in line with SeQura’s strategic goals. Document them.
Understand business problems and convey them into data science projects.
Collaborate with data engineers to create automated flows with datasets that are needed for the models.
Processing, cleaning and integrating large data sets.
Work with business analysts and internal stakeholders in order to prove the effectiveness of the model-driven decisions, identify issues and tackle them.




What you’ll need 🤓

Bachelor's degree in data science, mathematics, physics, computer science, engineering, or related field.
A Master in Data Science or proven knowledge of Data Science.
No previous experience required.
Advanced programming skills in Python and Sql. working knowledge of frameworks such as scikit-learn, Keras, PyTorch, Tensorflow, etc.
Strong analytical skills with a demonstrated ability to think critically and problem-solve.
A logical mindset and a natural curiosity for uncovering the root causes of problems.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with team members and stakeholders.
Fluent in English is a must.







Which are the next steps 🤝

HR interview
Technical interview
Meet the Head of Data & AI
Cultural interview







Do you want to be part of the change? Join us!👇

Show more

Title: AI/ML Engineer
Description:
Our cliente IAG is looking for a Software Engineer IA/ML




IAG is at the forefront of the AI revolution, driving innovation in ML, Cloud & Edge computing, and software engineering. Our projects span various sectors, including telecommunications, customer services, banking and insurance and leveraging the latest in AI technologies to solve real-world problems.




Role Overview:

We are recruiting an ambitious AI/ML Engineer to join our IAG technology team. You'll be instrumental in shaping our tech infrastructure, defining the strategic direction of our platforms, and overseeing their execution. This hands-on role involves leading the design and implementation of AI systems with a keen focus on scalability, efficiency, and impact.

You'll manage a skilled engineering team, foster cross-disciplinary cooperation, and play a key role in strategic planning. Your leadership will empower the team to make critical decisions and take full responsibility for innovative projects, with a strong emphasis on collaboration across engineering and business domains.




Key Responsibilities:

Design and deploy advanced machine learning models, focusing on Large Language Models (LLMs) to solve GenAI-based product problems.
Bring research concepts to implementation, creating AI-driven applications with direct business impact.
Collaborate closely with researchers, software engineers, and product managers to understand complex business challenges and deliver AI-powered solutions.
Implement scalable data pipelines and optimize models for performance and accuracy.
Ensure models are production-ready and maintain them to continue delivering value.
Stay updated with the latest developments in machine learning and AI.
Monitor and maintain deployed models, ensuring their effectiveness over time.
Navigate and prioritize tasks in an environment with loosely defined projects and competing deadlines.
Own problems end-to-end, acquiring necessary knowledge to get the job done.
Effectively manage multiple stakeholders, ensuring alignment of product development with business objectives.
You will work closely with a friendly, passionate innovative team located around the world.
You will have a key role and the opportunity to grow inside the organization.
You will experience awesome team spirit.
You will help to build, hire, and lead the dev team.




Qualifications:

Demonstrated experience in deep learning and transformer models.
Good Experience in Python, Java and JavaScript programming languages.
Proven experience in DevOps practices and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP).
Solid understanding of software development lifecycle, agile methodologies, and lean startup principles.
Excellent problem-solving, leadership, and communication skills.
3 to 5 + years of relevant experience in AI/ML projects, with a focus on NLP and LLM.
Proven expertise in building fine-tuned LLMs and implementing the latest research techniques such as continuous pre-training, (Q)LoRA, RLHF, RLAIF, DPO, etc.
Strong foundation in data structures, algorithms, and software engineering principles.
Research publication in ML field




Education

A master’s degree in computer science, AI, mathematics, or a related field.
Master’s degree or PhD in ML Engineering, Mathematics or Statistics.




Languages

Excellent conversational and written knowledge in English (C1 level minimum).
French and Spanish language skills are a bonus.




Tools and Applications

ML frameworks and tools: PyTorch, TensorFlow, Hugging Face.
ML operations tools: Weights & Biases (wandb), MLflow.
Data visualization tools: Matplotlib, Power BI.
Version control systems and collaborative development platforms.




Why Join Us?

Be part of a forward-thinking company that values innovation, creativity, and clean code.
Work on projects that have a real-world impact, leveraging cutting-edge technologies.
Collaborate with a global team of experts passionate about AI and new technologies.
Opportunities for personal and professional growth in a supportive and dynamic environment.




If you're ready to lead the charge in AI, apply to join our team!

Title: MLOps / Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
NTT DATA is the 6th biggest IT Service Company in the world with more than 100.000 professionals and a turnover of more than 15 billion euros.




We at NTT DATA Spain make the difference by being close to our clients, exceeding expectations, managing proactively our projects and customers and focusing on quality and selecting employees with the right mindset to make our company grow. The Group has the ambitious goal to position within the TOP 3 worldwide. We have been awarded Best Place to work in Spain for 4 consecutive years.




MLOps practices are both a strategic bet and a fast-growing initiative and thereby we are currently looking for a Data & Intelligence CoE LEADER. The position can be based in Spain Barcelona, even if the geographical scope is Europe. The desirable characteristics are:




What are we looking for?




We are seeking a ML Engineer to our team to take on the technical design and implementation in projects within the scope of our Data & Intelligence CoE, working in initiatives for top-tier organizations.




We are looking for a professional who brings his knowledge and experience in artificial intelligence focused on:




Defining and implementing technical solutions related to AI Platform framework/methodology.
Building AI Platforms aligned with the logical version defined in high-level architecture designs. Being a cloud-native, hybrid or on-premises environment.
Building CI/CD pipelines to orchestrate the MLOps life cycle aligned with client objectives and architecture requisites.
Contribute to the standardization of methodologies for development, training, deploying, inference and monitor of AI use cases.
Facing challenges related to MLOps practices, provide resources and tools for Data Scientist, give them flexibility for model development and robust methodology to allow its productivization, train models in an unattended way, monitorize the model performance and generate retrain alarms.




What will you be accountable for?




Your responsibilities around our artificial intelligence services will be focused on the following fields of action:




Project execution: ensuring the achievement of technical milestones in terms of effectiveness, efficiency and customer satisfaction. Identifying resources needed to do so while ensuring proper management of time, risk and quality.
Development of IaC scripts and pipelines to automate management and deployment of AI Platforms.
Development of CI/CD pipelines leveraging model development industrialization.
Development of custom software integrations to integrate external systems with the AI Platform.
Technical decision making.







Why would we want to meet you?




We want to meet you if:




You have 3 or more years of experience with AI-related projects.
You have experience working with IaC (CDK, Terraform, Ansible, etc.)
You have experience working with CI/CD tools (Jenkins, GitHub Actions, etc.)
You have strong coding skills in any of the most well-known Object-Oriented languages: Python, Java, C#, etc.
You have worked with artificial intelligence in a startup, large company or academic environment helping Data Scientist to deploy their work in production.
You are oriented to achieving high quality results and continuously improving.
You are committed to transmitting knowledge to the entire team.




We will positively value:




Experience with MLOps tools and frameworks, either from the Open-Source community or from a specific cloud provider.
Building CI/CD pipelines in the context of artificial intelligence.
Software design patterns knowledge.
Data Engineering skills and knowledge.
Experience with model and data monitoring.
IAM knowledge (users, groups, roles, permissions, etc.)




What do we offer?




We propose:




To work on projects for leading companies in Spanish and European market.
To be involved in high priority projects with visibility to senior leadership
To apply the latest technical innovations in artificial intelligence platforms in AWS.
To attend and give conferences.
To join the team of a consolidated multinational such as NTT Data, which shares with you its professional interests and enjoys applying artificial intelligence in large companies and public agencies.
A competitive salary according to provided experience.
A career path that ensures your professional development and continuous improvement (language courses, management and professional skill training, technical training and certifications).




If you are interested or would like to have more information, please apply via this advertisement.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
¿Te apasiona la ciencia de datos y el desarrollo de soluciones analíticas? 👀




➥ Unirte a Innova, es formar parte de una empresa de consultoría líder a nivel nacional y en pleno desarrollo internacional. Si estás interesado en participar en proyectos innovadores de IA, Cloud Computing y Transformación Digital, creemos este es tu lugar. 🤝




En Innova-tsn buscamos incorporar profesionales con 3 años de experiencia en proyectos de ciencia de datos y modelización avanzada, para reforzar nuestro equipo en diferentes sectores como energía, retail, banca y más.




📌 ¿Qué buscamos?




Experiencia como Data Scientist de al menos 3 años en desarrollo y mantenimiento de modelos.
Conocimiento avanzado de técnicas de tratamiento y preparación de datos y analítica descriptiva.
Conocimiento del desarrollo, mantenimiento y monitorización de modelos de Machine Learning (Regresión, Clustering, XGBoost, Random Forest….) y técnicas de Forecasting.
Conocimiento avanzado de los lenguajes Python y R.
Estudios mínimos: Licenciatura/Grado en Matemáticas, Estadística, Ingeniería, Físicas, Económicas…




✅ ...es un plus!

Buen nivel en SAS y PySpark.
Perfil matemático con habilidades técnicas en el entorno de datos.




📈 ¿Qué valoramos?




Máster en Data Science, Machine Learning, Inteligencia Artificial.
Experiencia en Desarrollo de Redes Neuronales en frameworks como Keras, Pytorch, TensorFlow.
Conocimiento/experiencia de algoritmos de Optimización.
Experiencia en el desarrollo en entornos colaborativos (Github, Gitlab).
Experiencia en MLOps.
Conocimiento de LLMs: Técnicas de Prompt Engineering, RAG y Fine tuning.
·Experiencia /certificación en plataformas Cloud (AWS, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud) tanto en el desarrollo como el despliegue de modelos.
Nivel avanzado de inglés.
Habilidad para trabajar en equipo y aportar en entornos colaborativos.




👋 ¿Qué te ofrecemos nosotros?




Contrato indefinido, invertimos y buscamos tu desarrollo a largo plazo.
Formaciones en plataformas e internas, y certificaciones oficiales a cargo de la empresa.
Planes de carrera personalizados, adaptados a tus fortalezas e intereses y basados en evaluaciones de desempeño anuales.
Beneficios sociales: seguro médico de cobertura completa.
Retribución flexible: ticket guardería y ticket restaurant.
Ser parte de un equipo especializado en soluciones empresariales y arquitectura de datos.




En Innova, fomentamos mucho el desarrollo del talento, la creatividad y el trabajo en equipo. Invertimos en espacios, tecnologías y herramientas para que los que componen nuestra compañía profundicen en sus habilidades, exploren nuevas áreas y se sientan una pieza fundamental.




Si estás buscando un lugar donde impulsar y desarrollar tu carrera profesional, únete a nosotros y sé parte de este equipo innovador 🤓

  • Planes de carrera personalizados, adaptados a tus fortalezas e intereses y basados en evaluaciones de desempeño anuales.
  • Beneficios sociales: seguro médico de cobertura completa.
  • Retribución flexible: ticket guardería y ticket restaurant.
  • Ser parte de un equipo especializado en soluciones empresariales y arquitectura de datos.


En Innova, fomentamos mucho el desarrollo del talento, la creatividad y el trabajo en equipo. Invertimos en espacios, tecnologías y herramientas para que los que componen nuestra compañía profundicen en sus habilidades, exploren nuevas áreas y se sientan una pieza fundamental.


Si estás buscando un lugar donde impulsar y desarrollar tu carrera profesional, únete a nosotros y sé parte de este equipo innovador 🤓

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
📌 Job Description: Data Scientist (ML & LLMs)

Location: Spain

Working hours: Ability to work EST hours.

We are seeking a Data Scientist with strong expertise in Machine Learning, LLMs, and AI-driven solutions. The ideal candidate will have a solid foundation in statistical models, ML techniques, and hands-on experience with LLM development. This role requires proficiency in Python, Docker, and GitLab CI/CD, with GCP as a mandatory skill.

🛠️ Responsibilities

Develop, train, and optimize traditional machine learning models for data analysis and predictive insights.
Apply expertise in LLMs, prompt engineering, and AI model optimization to build and refine AI applications.
Utilize Python, Docker, and GitLab CI/CD for model automation, testing, and deployment.
(Preferred) Implement FastAPI for building scalable APIs and integrating ML models into production environments.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive AI-powered innovations and ensure project success.
Maintain a high standard of coding, version control, and model performance evaluation.

🎯 Requirements

5+ years of experience in Data Science, Machine Learning, or AI.
Hands-on experience with LLMs, AI model optimization & prompt engineering.
GCP proficiency is required.
Strong expertise in Python, Docker, and GitLab CI/CD for model development.
Knowledge of statistical models and data science principles.
(Preferred) FastAPI experience for API development & deployment.
Strong problem-solving and teamwork skills.
Al least Upper-Intermediate level of English.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Behind the user-friendly Fever apps and site is our Engineering team.

We build and maintain the tech that powers Fever, helping millions enjoy unforgettable experiences worldwide.




About the role

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you'll shape how ML is done at Fever. You'll own and scale end-to-end ML pipelines, working closely with data scientists and engineers to turn ideas into real impact. From experiment setup to deploying models in production, you’ll help drive smarter decisions and better user experiences.




Key responsibilities

Deploy models that power decisions and user features
Build scalable, reproducible ML infrastructure
Monitor model quality and automate training
Create tools that make the business more efficient
Balance technical trade-offs and make smart decisions




About you

Smart, proactive, and thrive in fast-paced environments
Strong experience building production-ready ML pipelines
Solid Python skills and knowledge of the data/ML ecosystem
Experience with AWS and Docker
Write clean, scalable code and follow engineering best practices
Fluent in business English




Nice to have

Experience with Kubernetes, EKS, SageMaker, MLFlow
Familiar with Django, FastAPI, Airflow
Worked with marketing, product, or analytics teams
Built ML-powered tools, whether at work or for fun




On your first month at Fever:

Fully onboarded and integrated into the team
Deep dive into our ML efforts and tech stack
Meet key people across Fever
Experience one of our Fever Originals, like Candlelight




After 3 months:

Solving real problems and generating business impact
Owning parts of the modeling pipeline
Connected with most of the data and engineering team




On your 6th month:

Your models will be live, improving user experiences
You’ll push for improvements in tools and processes
Supporting and mentoring new joiners
Joining team events and offsites




Benefits & Perks

Attractive compensation package consisting of base salary and the potential to earn a significant bonus for top performance.
Stock options.
Opportunity to have a real impact in a high-growth global category leader
40% discount on all Fever events and experiences
Home office friendly, location in Madrid or Barcelona required
Responsibility from day one and professional and personal growth
Great work environment with a young, international team of talented people to work with!
Health insurance and other benefits such as Flexible remuneration with a 100% tax exemption through Cobee.
English Lessons
Gympass Membership
Possibility to receive in advance part of your salary by Payflow.

Title: Data scientist Junior & Senior
Description:
En QUANT AI LAB, seguimos creciendo para desarrollar las más avanzadas soluciones de inteligencia artificial y analíticas del mercado, siempre desde la vanguardia y unos conocimientos técnicos asentados. Unirse a QUANT AI LAB significa unirse a una aventura donde cada miembro es una parte importante de este proyecto, y cada parte resulta esencial para hacerlo realidad.




Como parte de nuestra continua apuesta por el progreso, estamos buscando reforzar nuestra división especializada en el desarrollo de soluciones analítico-cognitivas avanzadas y de vanguardia con la incorporación de varios perfiles de alto nivel, experiencia y conocimiento técnico en las líneas priorizadas más abajo.




El objetivo de esta división es doble: 1) contribuir al desarrollo de productos y soluciones propias de la compañía; y 2) apoyar y asistir a nuestros clientes en su apuesta por estas tecnologías, trabajando codo con codo en el desarrollo de soluciones innovadoras específicamente aplicadas a su contexto de negocio.




Estamos buscando reforzar nuestra división de élite de Inteligencia Artificial con varios Data Scientist con +3 años de experiencia, que posean un profundo y sólido conocimiento de las técnicas de inteligencia artificial, su diseño, conceptualización, desarrollo y puesta en producción. Estas personas se incorporarán a un equipo de élite y de grandes profesionales, para abordar proyectos avanzados de analítica e inteligencia artificial, trabajando con algunas de las tecnologías más avanzadas del momento, y con impacto internacional.




Entre las funciones de este equipo se encuentran:




Conceptualización, diseño e implementación de soluciones de inteligencia artificial con impacto directo en nuestros clientes.
Gestión de alcance, proyectos, desarrollos y entregables.
Implementación de las redes y algoritmos necesarios según los requerimientos del problema.
Participación de forma activa en el diseño y desarrollo de los procesos asociados a servicios analítico-cognitivos.
Participación en el diseño, desarrollo e integración.
Identificación de nuevas tecnologías, tendencias y soluciones que permitan ofrecer la máxima calidad y eficiencia de las soluciones.
Coordinación y colaboración con los equipos de Data Science para la implementación y puesta en producción de la solución.
Colaboración con el resto del equipo de Data e IA, formado por algunos de los mejores Data Scientist, Data Engineers, e investigadores del país.
Velar por la calidad de los desarrollos y limpieza del código (Clean Code), manteniendo los más altos estándares calidad y rigurosidad.
Proactividad y resolución de problemas.




Las competencias y conocimientos del candidato son:




Imprescindible




Preferible graduado en informática, o titulación técnica superior similar (matemáticas, físicas..).
Máster en Inteligencia Artificial. Se valora muy positivamente el doctorado.
Buen nivel de inglés, oral y escrito.
Experiencia demostrable y conocimientos sólidos en Inteligencia artificial.
Experiencia trabajando en la codificación y puesta en producción de modelos analíticos y de inteligencia artificial.
Altos estándares de codificación, gestión de código (GIT), etc.
Alto nivel de SQL y Python.
Experiencia demostrable en Cloud (AWS, Azure o GCP).










Capacidades blandas




Altas capacidades de comunicación, tanto verbal como escrita.
Capacidad de trabajo en equipo, y actitud resolutiva.
Proactividad
Experiencia tratando y comunicando con clientes, y presentación de resultados.
Dinamismo, agilidad resolutiva, y propositiva de soluciones.
Proactividad, alto nivel de compromiso y cumplimiento de entregables.
Ganas de aprender, colaborar y mejorar.




Todos los candidatos podrán ser sometidos a una prueba y entrevista técnica.







QUANT AI LAB, lo que le ofrecemos:




Contribuir al desarrollo de una empresa internacional en continuo crecimiento y desarrollando proyectos y productos de vanguardia.
Integrar un equipo multidisciplinar con formación profesional y académica de alto nivel, compuesto por algunos de los mayores expertos en el área de la inteligencia artificial, analítica avanzada y tratamiento del dato.
La oportunidad de trabajar directamente con clientes de talla internacional, y algunas de las mayores compañías del país y del mundo.
Un entorno de trabajo colaborativo, emprendedor y solidario, y un equipo joven y dinámico en el que todos se apoyan para crecer juntos.
Un ambiente divertido y agradable y eventos festivos (afterworks, seminarios...).
Contrato indefinido y un salario muy competitivo, que se determinará en función del perfil y la experiencia.







Si crees que puedes aportar a nuestra unidad analítica de vanguardia estaremos encantados de conocerte.
